CONTRACT_TITLE: London and Quadrant Housing Trust — Cement Weatherboarding (Merchants) Framework 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250 000 people in more than 95 000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Concrete Weatherboarding Merchants for London and Quadrant’s Self Delivered new build projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a framework agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for merchants only. Rebates will be required.

CONTRACT_TITLE: CPU 2157 Care at Home Services for Adults Accreditation
CONTRACT_DESC: Nottingham City Council is to establish a new accredited provider list of experienced organisations able to deliver care at home for adults. The accreditation will form the mechanism for securing providers that are required in addition to those provided under the lead provider contracts for this service.

CONTRACT_TITLE: HQIP NCA 2057 The National Audit of Dementia
CONTRACT_DESC: The National Audit of Dementia (NAD) was first commissioned by HQIP in 2008 and has been delivered to date by the Royal College of Psychiatrists. Designed as a comparative audit of the quality of care delivered to people with dementia admitted to general hospitals, national data collections were achieved in 2010 and 2012, with the latest 5 year contract in place from 2015 until the end of 2019. The successful tenderer will build on the experiences and achievements of the audit since its inception.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TD1394 — The Provision of Interpretation and Translation Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Derby City Council requires interpretation and translation services to facilitate access to Council services for its citizens who have English as an additional language.

CONTRACT_DESC: Individual supported living for 5 adults who have a learning disability living in the community in 3 groupings in the Southend-on-Sea area.

CONTRACT_TITLE: West Suffolk Garden Waste
CONTRACT_DESC: Manage, maintain and operate composting facilities to accept and process garden waste collected by West Suffolk on the days and times required. Core operating hours when the facilities must be open to receive garden waste are 7.00 to 17.00 Monday to Friday. The contractor shall ensure that consents and planning permissions allow for additional opening when requested which may include weekends, public holidays, bank holidays and late opening. West Suffolk will work with the successful contractor to establish dates where bank holiday/weekend working is required. Receive and process garden waste to produce a compost material to accepted industry standards. For the avoidance of doubt the processed material must be classed as recycled in accordance with National Indicator 192 (http://www.sandwelltrends.info/lisv2/ni_handbook/NI192.pdf) or any future amendment to this standard.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Integrated Sexual Health Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The services commissioned by East Riding of Yorkshire Public Health will comprise of an open access community based service delivered across a large rural area. It will incorporate: the provision of the full range of contraceptive methods, STI testing and treatment and will include HIV testing, and prevention and promotion activities. The service does not include long acting reversible contraception or emergency hormonal contraception services in primary care; which are commissioned separately.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Suffolk Young Carers Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Suffolk County Council are seeking to commission a provider to deliver a service that will effectively engage and identify with young carers, complete statutory assessments on young carers and then provide appropriate information, advice and guidance to ensure their needs are properly supported. This will include the provider keeping an up to date register of all young carers who have accessed the service and the support they require to maintain their caring responsibilities.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Advertising and Media Consultation and Buying Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The University is seeking to appoint up to 3 agencies to provide comprehensive advertising and media buying services (excluding staff recruitment) that reflect the University’s corporate branding, vision and values and elevates the University’s position in the UK and global HE sectors.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Trade Mission Project Management
CONTRACT_DESC: Welsh Government is committed to working with companies to help them to grow their exports. This includes providing access to key export information, tailored support for market entry, support to visit overseas markets and attendance at international trade fairs overseas.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Gas Central Heating and Boiler Replacement Contract 2020/2025
CONTRACT_DESC: Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council is seeking tenders from experienced contractors to provide gas central heating and boiler replacement for contract period 2020-2025 to service almost 22 000 Council properties. The works will include carrying out gas central heating repairs and boiler replacement to void and occupied tenanted domestic dwellings. This will also include carrying out responsive day to day, planned, reactive and emergency repairs as required where necessary replacement of appliances and systems. Operate out of hours emergency including call out repairs service. The duration of the contract will be 5 years with an initial term 3 years with option to extend by aggregate 24 months subject to satisfactory performance during the initial term. The project will comprise planned works programme which includes typically replacement of existing type boilers, controls and radiators in general needs properties, full dwelling replacement of existing central heating system.

CONTRACT_DESC: This procurement will establish a framework covering the purchase of estates consumable products for example, tools, electrical items, building products, plumbing, timber and joinery, paints and solvents, ironmongery, mechanical and industrial consumables, plant hire and signage (NHS). Each product area will be covered by an individual lot, or sub lots. Member organisations will access the NOECPC electronic catalogue via the e-catalogue system, either by excel export or by integration into the member organisations cataloguing system. Member organisations will be able to order products, utilising either an electronic catalogue, or by running a further competition. Please refer to the relevant lot descriptions for further details.

CONTRACT_TITLE: BC-10602 Thomas Deacon Education Trust Cleaning
CONTRACT_DESC: Thomas Deacon Education Trust is a Peterborough based trust comprising 6 schools, 1 all through, 4 primaries and 1 secondary. The secondary school, Queen Katharine Academy, is a PFI school and is managed under that agreement so is therefore excluded from this tender. The contract period will be for 3 years initially with the option to extend for 2 further 1 year periods. The current provision is a mixture of outsourced suppliers and in-house cleaners, depending on school, so an LGPS component is expected. The contract will be for daily cleaning during term time and out of term deep cleans.

CONTRACT_TITLE: BC-10598 Inspiring Primaries Academy Trust Catering
CONTRACT_DESC: Inspiring Primaries Academy Trust, formed in June 2017, is located in Leicestershire. They are a charitable, school led multi academy trust of Church of England schools and community schools working closely together in service to their local communities. The proposed contract will be for the outsourced provision of catering services to the client. It is the client’s expectation that the successful bidder shall be responsible for the operation of the catering function including employment and management of staff, supply of foodstuffs, consumables and light equipment and preparing and serving appropriate meals. The contract period will be for 3 years initially with the option to extend for 2 further 1 year periods. The schools all currently receive their catering services from a local authority provider. There will be catering staff on the Local Government Pension Scheme (LGPS). There are currently 9 primary schools part of the Trust.

The provision of the 0-19 (up to 25 years for young people with special educational needs and disabilities) Public Health Nursing Service. The Council proposes to enter into one contract for a period of 3 years with provision for a 2-year extension with the successful tenderer (Contractor). CONTRACT_TITLE: R0003A Water Hygiene Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Radius Housing Association is seeking to appoint a contractor to provide a comprehensive water hygiene services contract for approximately 220 social housing sites across Northern Ireland. The contract period will be for a maximum of 5 years duration. The contract will include an option to be extended at the end of year 3 for a further 1 + 1 year period at the sole discretion of the employer. The Association has previously completed full risk assessments for the affected properties. Fully compliant legionella risk assessments will be required at the end of year 1 on all of the 220 sites. The contractor must also make provision to provide the services for new buildings constructed or acquired by the Association throughout the contract period that will require a programme of essential inspection, monitoring/testing/recording and planned preventative maintenance works.

CONTRACT_TITLE: UK SBS PR19072 Flip Chip Aligner
CONTRACT_DESC: UK Research and Innovation's (UKRI) Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC) develop detectors to cover a broad range of scientific measurement in the X-ray, infrared, visible light, neutron, gamma ray parts of the EM spectrum. UKRI-STFC require a flip chip bonder which will perform the assembly of such a range of radiation sensitive detectors. The detectors generally consist of a 2D array of complementary metal oxide semiconductor (CMOS) readout integrated circuit (ROIC), bonded to a geometrically similar 2D array of solid-state sensor material to form a hybrid pixel sensor. In many cases, the ROIC is silicon, but often the sensor is selected to provide specific detection properties for the radiation range being sensed. This means that a wide variety of sensor materials are possible, including but not limited to silicon, germanium, cadmium telluride, cadmium zinc telluride, gallium arsenide and gallium antimonide. Please refer to the tender documents for the full specification.

It is considered that this contract amendment can be awarded using the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(ii) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011). This is for technical reasons — the UK C130J aircraft cannot be supported or maintained without access to proprietary information and data relating to the aircraft structure/systems, with Marshall of Cambridge Aerospace Ltd solely licensed to conduct this work by LMA as the SBLOS Prime Contractor.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Adult Community Based Drug and Alcohol Treatment Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The current service is a combined drug and alcohol treatment and support service. The programmes currently available range from information and advice to medically assisted detoxification; from one-to-one sessions to structured day-programmes; from needle exchange services to prescribing programmes; and from volunteering opportunities to formal education sessions. The new service will encompass much of what is currently provided but, reflecting the reduced budget, the expectations of the Provider in relation to several elements of the service (such as in-house mental health care; criminal justice interventions; and smoking cessation) have been reduced. The new service will increase the provision of early interventions through a programme of training and support for non-specialist agencies.

This programme includes the provision of contextual and performance data served to external applications through a direct data feed and a range of tailored online tools and applications to support small area reporting, managing open linked data publishing,information governance, information sharing standards and specific tools and data sets.

CONTRACT_TITLE: YORcivil Major Works Contractors Framework Agreement
CONTRACT_DESC: A framework agreement to serve all public sector bodies (and their statutory successors) and third sector organisations in the Yorkshire and Humber region and the Sheffield Local Enterprise Partnership region as detailed in the procurement documents. The works involved are principally civil engineering works, bridges/structure works, highway surfacing works and flood alleviation works, including contractors design when required. In addition some building works may also be included. The full list of accessing bodies is detailed within VI.3). Principles of collaborative working and partnering will be key to the relationships under the framework.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Contract Award Brent Cross West Station
CONTRACT_DESC: Contract award following competitive procedure with negotiation for a new station Brent Cross West on the Midland Main Line (MML). The new station is part of the wider Brent Cross Cricklewood (BXC) development. Outline planning consent for the development has been granted. The new station is required to be completed, commissioned, handed over into operations and maintenance by May 2022. The project proposals have been developed to GRIP4 (single option development)and have achieved approval in principle. London Borough of Barnet (LBB) requires the scheme to be developed to the completion of GRIP stages 5 to 8.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DPS Estate Works and External Decoration Across Powys

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of a Research Management and Collaboration Solution
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Southampton has been awarded a contract to continue the administration of research funding on behalf of the Department of Health and Social Care. The new contract commenced on 1.4.2018 and will run initially up to 31.3.2023 with an option to extend for a further 4 years. In order to meet the requirements of the new contract the University will be replacing its current grants management platform. This procurement sought an innovative technology provider to deliver a research management and collaboration solution to support core business processes, facilitate interoperability with partner organisations and third party systems, and aid us in meeting contractual commitments to simplify and expedite the commissioning of research. We sought to engage a technology provider who can deliver technical solutions, support the ongoing development and innovations for the solution and provide advice to meet our business need.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Corporate Signage and Furniture
CONTRACT_DESC: FLS require to put in place a framework to support the procurement of the manufacture and delivery of high-quality outdoor timber; corporate Signs (e.g. primary, secondary, threshold signs and way-markers); furniture (e.g. picnic benches) and structures (e.g. to hold and display information panels).

CONTRACT_DESC: St John's, Marlborough are currently out to tender for the provision of their catering service. St John’s is an internationally renowned 11-18 co-educational secondary school which converted to academy status in 2012.The academy caters for more than 1 600 pupils including sixth form provision.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Create Partnership Trust — Cleaning Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Create Partnership Trust are currently out to tender for the provision of a cleaning service for 4 schools: Brookfields Primary School, Conway Primary School, Greet Primary School and Hodge Hill Primary School. The contract will be for a period of 3 years with the possibility to extend for a further 2 x 12 month periods. TUPE is expected to apply and all relevant information is included within the tender documents.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Street Sweepings Treatment and Recycling Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Street sweeping treatment and recycling service within Norfolk, handling the WDA’s street sweepings and process/recycle street sweepings in line with the service specification. A contract to run from 30.12.2019 through to 30.9.2025.

CONTRACT_TITLE: The Keys Academy Trust — Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The Keys Academy Trust are currently out to tender for the provision of catering services across 4 schools in the Trust: St Sebastian's CofE Primary School, Earley St Peter's CofE Primary School, the Coombes CofE Primary School and new build, Alder Grove CofE Primary School. The contract being tendered is for a period of 3 years, with the option to extend for a further 2 x 12-month periods. TUPE is expected to apply and all relevant information is included within the tender documents.

CONTRACT_TITLE: NHS South Yorkshire and Bassetlaw ICS: Individual Placement Support (IPS)
CONTRACT_DESC: The overall vision for the individual placement and support service (the Service) is to reduce health inequalities and enable people with severe and enduring mental health problems to be able to enjoy a good quality of life, remain independent and in control, be included as members of society and, most importantly, realise their potential for recovery. The Service will deliver an integrated, evidence-based, supported employment service for people with severe and enduring mental health issues, following the principles of IPS and in pursuit of a high fidelity service.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Reducing Insecurity and Violent Extremism in Northern and Coastal Regions of Kenya (RE-Invent) Programme
CONTRACT_DESC: RE-Invent is a 19 550 000 GBP 5-year programme that aims to enhance Kenyan capacity and capability to address inter-communal conflict, weak community-police relations, violence against women and girls (VAWG), violent extremism and election related violence. It will support the continued advancement of police reforms to improve the management, oversight and accountability of the police force. There is the possibility of a 2-year extension of up to 10 000 000 GBP.

CONTRACT_TITLE: WP3325 — Supported Living for Complex Needs
CONTRACT_DESC: WP3325 — Provision of supported living services for complex needs. Walsall MBC has set up a framework of suitably qualified and experienced suppliers to provide supported living services for adults and young people with complex needs. Applications to the framework was via an electronic process using the council’s e-tendering system. The duration of the framework will be for a period of 3 years or 36 months with the option to extend, (one year at a time) for an additional 2 years or 24 months. Walsall MBC and the other organisation named here are permitted to award contracts under the framework. The other organisation is: Walsall Clinical Commissioning Group (WCCG). The Council reserves the right to re-open the framework agreement to invite further bids during the term of the agreement. This was advertised in the initial tender documents, satisfying the transparency and equal treatment requirements under the light touch regime.

CONTRACT_TITLE: PSNI:2138641 — Property Management Services for Police Service of Northern Ireland
CONTRACT_DESC: The service provider is required to deliver the client's estate management strategy for the continued development of the PSNI's buildings and facilities under the following service areas: security, health and safety, audit, financial control and management, contracts management, help desk, property management, maintenance, micro works, projects, energy and utilities management, completion and settlement and variable services. The contract will be awarded on the basis of best price quality ratio and use the narrow average, price scoring mechanism.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DfI — Safe and Sustainable Travel, DfI Advertising Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: The Department for Infrastructure (DfI) wishes to appoint an advertising agency to deliver advertising services and associated activity, including digital, to promote safe and sustainable travel in Northern Ireland. The purpose of the contract is to influence positive change in road user behaviours and a modal shift towards sustainable, mainly active travel.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Care Coordination: Out of Hospital End of Life Care
CONTRACT_DESC: The contracting authority Southampton City CCG is seeking to direct award a contract to Countess Mountbatten Charity Hospice, for the provision of care coordination: out of hospital end of life care. The commissioner’s intention is to work with an experienced charitable partner to understand whether the current EOL coordination centre model on the Isle of Wight can be successfully replicated for the residents of Southampton City. Mountbatten is Southampton’s charitable provider of hospice care and has vast experience in reliably providing a holistic approach to end of life care supporting and benefiting people before and after death, in a place and time when it is needed most. The CCGs investment in this provision is 729 052 GBP per annum, total potential life of contract 3 645 260 GBP (3 yrs + 2). The length of the contract will be 3 years plus 2 years optional extension.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Tony Byiast trading as Byiast Driving Academy
CONTRACT_TITLE: 0665 Driver Training (NDORS and Non-NDORS)
CONTRACT_DESC: ECC appointed driver trainers onto a framework agreement, using the light touch regime, to deliver both theory and practical training courses, covering National Driver Offender Re-training Scheme (NDORS) courses, other non-NDORS courses, commissioned by the Safer Essex Roads Partnership (SERP) and in-house driving-related courses. Courses will be delivered at venues throughout Essex. The framework is split into 6 No lots. Bidders were able to apply for all lots, however the successful bidder for Lot A6 was precluded from being appointed to Lots A1-A5. There was no limit on the number of suppliers appointed to the framework for Lots A1-A5. Lot A6 was limited to 1 supplier. The framework agreement duration will be 4 years.

There was no limit on the number of suppliers appointed to the framework for Lots A1-A5. Lot A6 was limited to 1 supplier. The framework agreement duration will be 4 years.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Armoured Vehicles Programmes — Artillery Systems Programme
CONTRACT_TITLE: Manufacture and Support of Mobile Artillery Battlefield Radar (MAMBA) Mid-Life Extension (MLE)
CONTRACT_DESC: Repair and maintenance services of military electronic systems. The Artillery Systems Team, part of the UKMinistry of Defence (‘MOD’), intends to award SAAB AB the Mobile Artillery Monitoring Battlefield Radar (MAMBA) Mid Life Extension (MLE) addressing end of life equipment/components via technical re-design and re-configuring the Radar equipment within a standardized 12 ft container so that the system is vehicle agnostic, this includes obsolescence rectification, equipment modification/re-design, post MLE includes obsolescence management, maintenance, repair and configuration management of the Mobile Artillery Monitoring Battlefield Radar (MAMBA) MLE for a total period of 8 years which includes 5 years in-service support. The estimated value of the contract is 38 000 000 GBP including innovative support.

CONTRACT_TITLE: AC0366 Help to Live at Home Alliance ‘New’
CONTRACT_DESC: Wiltshire Council is seeking to create an alliance of home care providers to provide help to live at home services in Wiltshire. The help to live at home alliance will be created by establishing a Pseudo Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) to procure these services which fall within the light-touch regime (LTR — PCR 2015 Regulations 74-77). The Pseudo DPS will in many respects look and feel like a DPS set up under PCR 2015 Regulation 34, but the flexibility of the LTR will apply. None of the formal procedural rules have any direct application including the requirements of Regulation 34. Wiltshire Council makes this distinction to avoid implying that it will follow, or be bound by, the full procurement regime under PCR 2015 for this procurement.

The Pseudo DPS will in many respects look and feel like a DPS set up under PCR 2015 Regulation 34, but the flexibility of the LTR will apply. None of the formal procedural rules have any direct application including the requirements of Regulation 34. Wiltshire Council makes this distinction to avoid implying that it will follow, or be bound by, the full procurement regime under PCR 2015 for this procurement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Main Contractor Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Hyde anticipates building approximately 11 000 mixed tenure homes over the next 5 years, and we are seeking partners to work with us to help realise this objective. Hyde wants to become synonymous with creating beautifully designed homes where people want to live, which are socially and economically successful and with quality placed at the heart of what we do. Our customers rightly demand high standards of quality and finish —whatever price they may pay for their home. This can range from a subsidised rent of 150 GBP per week rent through to 1 000 000 GBP purchase price for an apartment. The scope of works required will differ under each call-off contract, but the programme primarily covers new build residential works, with the possibility of some ancillary retail and commercial development. Successful contractors will be expected to work collaboratively with Hyde, and will be expected to have an understanding of delivering mixed tenure developments and providing added value.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Main Contractor Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Hyde anticipates building approximately 11 000 mixed tenure homes over the next 5 years, and we are seeking partners to work with us to help realise this objective. Hyde wants to become synonymous with creating beautifully designed homes where people want to live, which are socially and economically successful and with quality placed at the heart of what we do. Our customers rightly demand high standards of quality and finish —whatever price they may pay for their home. This can range from a subsidised rent of 150 GBP per week rent through to 1 000 000 GBP purchase price for an apartment. The scope of works required will differ under each call-off contract, but the programme primarily covers new build residential works, with the possibility of some ancillary retail and commercial development. CONTRACT_TITLE: WP3526 — Integrated Drug and Alcohol Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Walsall Metropolitan Borough Council are seeking to contract with a single provider or consortium of providers (Council contracting with a ‘Lead Provider’) with the expertise to deliver an integrated drug and alcohol support service that is a single assessment, intervention and recovery system, supported by medical interventions for stabilisation and maintenance, with delivery of evidence based psychosocial interventions that support recovery. The services will be offered on a continuum to match needs, delivering advice, information, harm reduction interventions and structured interventions. The contract is for 5 years with the option to extend for a further 2 years and is expected to commence 1.4.2020. The estimated value of the contract over the 7 years is 19 170 000 GBP, which is based on an estimated annual budget of up to 2 740 000 GBP. Potential providers need to be aware that TUPE will apply to this service contract. Further details are available in the TUPE documents contained in the ITT.

CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS Supply Chain Collaborative Procurement Partnership LLP (acting on behalf of Supply Chain Coordination Ltd (SCCL) whose registered office is at Skipton House, 80 London Road, London, SE1 6LH
CONTRACT_TITLE: Total Orthopaedic Solutions 2
CONTRACT_DESC: The Total Orthopaedic Solutions 2 framework is the second iteration of the successful framework for the provision or orthopaedic goods and services to the NHS which was introduced in 2014. It combines the existing frameworks: total orthopaedic solutions and the DHL MSK framework, to produce a single comprehensive agreement, focused on delivering continued benefits and value to the NHS and its patients. There shall be 10 orthopaedic lots detailed in this notice. The list of eligible entities who may utilise the resulting agreement can be found in this notice within Lot 1 at Sections II.2.4), II.2.11) and Section VI.3) and shall apply to all 10 lots. See Annex A2 of ITT for more detail.

All Scottish Hospices.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Investment Advisory Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The purpose of this procurement exercise is to appoint a single provider to deliver an independent investment and corporate finance advisory service in relation to a portfolio of venture capital investments (including a small element of debt funding) in SMEs based in the North East of England. The successful bidder will be responsible for maximising the financial returns from an existing investment portfolio by engaging with management teams to develop realisation strategies, negotiating with interested parties and advising the Board of NEF Holdco on suitable assets for disposal.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Responsive Repairs for Peabody Trust
CONTRACT_DESC: Peabody Group are seeking to appoint contractors to provide responsive repairs and specialist works amongst our 55 000 strong properties, in London, Essex and the South East. To deliver this service Peabody Group will appoint multiple contractors to a framework to provide a comprehensive responsive repairs service across 3 geographic lots, with one, prime contractor per lot. Beyond this, it will be expected that each of the contractor’s appointed to the 3 core regions will serve as a back-up contractor to additional regions (as defined in the ITT/SQ documents). This back-up mechanism and the mechanics of triggering of it is described in full in the ITT/SQ documents.

CONTRACT_DESC: Further to the award of the Home Support CQC Regulated Services Contracts earlier this year, the City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council has found it necessary to re-provision services in 2 specific locality areas and therefore seeks tenders from providers of home support services for personalised support and care to adults in the Bradford South, Wyke and Royds areas.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Security Systems Enterprise Service
CONTRACT_DESC: HMRC require an external business partner who can install and maintain a Cloud Based (Crown Hosted) Enterprise level unified access control and video system which must be compatible with existing and planned installations at our regional centres utilising a master application server and regional satellite application servers arrangement.

CONTRACT_DESC: HMRC require an external business partner who can install and maintain a Cloud Based (Crown Hosted) Enterprise level unified access control and video system which must be compatible with existing and planned installations at our regional centres utilising a master application server and regional satellite application servers arrangement.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Schroder and Co. Ltd Trading as Cazenove Capital
CONTRACT_TITLE: Contract for Investment Manager for Endowment Fundsi
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Reading has a number of endowment assets held across a variety of classes, including agricultural land and investment properties, as well as more traditional endowment funds. The total amount held within these endowment funds (mainly equities and bonds) totalled 122 800 000 GBP at 31.7.2019. The University of Reading and its associated Trusts and subsidiaries (the ‘University Group’), will appoint the bidder who can manage the 120 000 000 GBP+ of endowment portfolios as currently constituted, but with the capacity and expertise to expand the remit if required to include other classes of asset (such as private equity and infrastructure assets). This tender is for investment manager only, but the University is also interested in certain additional services. This is investment advice on a wider portfolio of assets. To this end, a second optional section and series of questions has been included.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Targeted Early Help Youth Provision
CONTRACT_DESC: Hull City Council invited qualified and interested suppliers to tender for the provision of a contract to secure a revised targeted early help youth provision. The service specification set out the requirements for targeted youth service provision. The programme aims to deliver ‘open access’ venues, to cast as wide a net as possible to engage young people, but with a clear focus on increasing targeted early help support and intervention for those young people in greatest need and at the greatest risk of poor outcomes. Under this contract Suppliers are required to actively contribute to the achievement of social objectives. These include: skills development; employment and training opportunities within the locality of where the contract will be delivered; and other added value initiatives throughout the supply chain to support community programmes promoted by the council. This contract was awarded to 8 service providers.

CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Devon Clinical Commissioning Group, acting as lead commissioner for Plymouth City Council and Torbay Council have commissioned community health and well-being services for children and young people in Devon.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Traffic Signals Supply and Install Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Worcestershire County Council (WCC) has a current term contract for delivering maintenance and the supply and installation of traffic signals. A recent programme to investigate and find efficiencies across the highway network has identified route corridors and specific sites where improvements could be made to route journey times, efficiency of junctions for all modes, as well as maintaining free-flow and reducing congestion, through traffic signal control improvements. In addition WCC are delivering a range of other infrastructure schemes which include traffic signal installation. These additional demands for installation/improvements to traffic signals will exceed the financial limits of the current contract and therefore WCC now requires a contract for the supply and installation of traffic signals. The successful supplier will need to work collaboratively with the existing traffic signals term maintenance contractor.

CONTRACT_TITLE: RNN003 Sub Contract Provision
CONTRACT_DESC: The RNN Group, comprising Rotherham College, Dearne Valley College, North Notts College and the University Centre Rotherham are looking to refresh their preferred supplier list. Successful providers will be listed on a 3-year framework with the potential to deliver education and training on behalf of the Group. Please note that this project is a Light Touch Regime. The Light Touch Regime is a specific set of rules for certain service contracts that tend to be of lower interest to cross border competition, defined by Common Procurement Vocabulary codes.

Bids are invited from suitably qualified insurance brokers/direct providers for the entire scope of services. The procurement will follow the 2-stage restricted procedure with a pre-qualifying stage based on ESPDs and bidders will be selected on the basis of their capability, capacity and experience to perform the contract.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS),
CONTRACT_TITLE: UK Emissions Permitting, Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (PMRV) System
CONTRACT_DESC: To deliver an IT system that facilitates the permitting, monitoring, reporting and verification of UK Green House Gas emissions in line with relevant legislation, as well as maintenance and support of the system and optional additional development services. It is intended that this system will form a vital part of the UK Emissions Trading Scheme, as well as inform the carbon emissions tax in the event the UK leaves the European Union without a withdrawal agreement. For further information, the full specification and further information on this project please see the ITT.

CONTRACT_TITLE: ITT269 Provision of a Student Record System
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Northampton is seeking to acquire a new student record system for an initial period of 5 years from October 2019 with the possibility of 5 additional 1 year extensions. The University has been using its current system since 2006. It has been the key product supporting application and admissions processing, student records, assessment, awards and student communications during this time. With its move to the brand new ‘Waterside’ campus in September 2018, the University is now looking for a system that covers the full student management and administration lifecycle from application to graduation and beyond; that provides an efficient processing tool for staff and a high quality interface to enhance the student and staff experience, can provide flexibility to support the University’s range of Higher Education provision, supports changes and compliance requirements of the UK Higher Education sector.

This also includes the reverse logistics of collections from YPO customers. YPO may require distribution solution from another warehouse location at any point throughout the life of the contract. The contract is designed to meet the needs of YPO’s internal requirements.

CONTRACT_TITLE: HC0572/HC0573 — GP and Pharmacy Commissioned Public Health Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Wiltshire Council is seeking to create a framework of public health service providers to provide commissioned public health services in Wiltshire. The framework will be created by establishing a pseudo dynamic purchasing system (DPS) to procure these services which fall within the light-touch regime (LTR — PCR2015 Regulations 74-77). The Pseudo DPS will in many respects look and feel like a DPS set up under PCR2015 Regulation 34, but the flexibility of the LTR will apply. None of the formal procedural rules have any direct application including the requirements of Regulation 34. Wiltshire Council makes this distinction to avoid implying that it will follow, or be bound by, the full procurement regime under PCR 2015 for this procurement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Combined Authority — Adult Education Budget 2019-22
CONTRACT_DESC: Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Combined Authority’s (CPCA) intentions for the procured element of the devolved Adult Education Budget (AEB) only. The overall commissioning approach for AEB will involve a combination of plan-led grant funding and procured provision. This tender is concerned solely with the procured activity. The principal purpose of the AEB is to engage adults aged 19+ and provide them with the required skills enabling them to enter and sustain employment, an apprenticeship/traineeship, or other further learning. In the Cambridgeshire and Peterborough region, devolution will enable adult skills provision and learning to be more flexible and agile in its application. The Cambridgeshire and Peterborough area has a population of over circa 850 000 and it consists of 6 local authority districts – the cities of Cambridge and Peterborough, the rural districts of East Cambridgeshire, Fenland, Huntingdonshire, and South Cambridgeshire. Cambridgeshire and Peterborough’s economic geography is defined by three labour market areas:

CONTRACT_TITLE: Assisted Conception for NHS Trafford CCG
CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Trafford Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) in their capacity as lead commissioner on behalf of the listed CCGs have sort bids to secure additional capacity for the provision of an assisted conception service.

CONTRACT_TITLE: BHCC MH Substance Misuse Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Drug and alcohol misuse continues to be a significant issue in Brighton and Hove, including drug-related deaths. Historically, Brighton and Hove has had one of the highest rates of drug-related deaths in the country. Concerted efforts have been successful in reducing drug-related deaths but the recent trend suggests that they are increasing again. This service sets to reduce drug-related deaths by providing a support and preemptive service.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Building and Facilities Management Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Soft FM including portering, cleaning, catering and associated services.

CONTRACT_TITLE: PRJ737 – Northamptonshire Shared Care Record Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Procurement of a shared care record service on behalf of the Northamptonshire CCGs for Northamptonshire Health and Care Partnership (NHCP). A shared care record (SCR) is a record that is built by integrating data and information held on patients across a range of health and social care providers. In this sense it is a data integration exercise but one that carries profound benefits for patient outcomes and local health and care provision.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Garden Waste Treatment Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Peterborough City Council (PCC) invites tenders from suitably experienced organisations who can demonstrate knowledge, skill and innovation in the provision of garden waste treatment services. The Council’s garden material is delivered to the Council’s Green Waste Transfer Station located in Dogsthorpe from 2 sources: a household kerbside collection and the Householders Recycling Centre (HRC) situated in Fengate. The successful supplier will be responsible for managing the Council’s Green Waste Transfer Station, Bulking up, Haulage and Treating the waste in accordance with the Council’s specification. The Transfer of Undertaking (Protection of Employment) (TUPE) Regulations 2006 will apply to this tender, bidders will be required to download, sign and upload, through the Q&A section, a TUPE Undertaking of Confidentiality in the Council’s e-procurement system, SourceDogg, before the Council is able to provide the TUPE details and information.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Market Research Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Market research is commissioned for a variety of purposes within the BBC across the full range of different audiences for its programmes and services. The BBC also has a clear strategy to engage with and target youth audiences, reflecting the changing nature on how content is discovered and consumed by the next audience generation. The research will inform strategic policy, commissioning and editorial decisions, as well as ensuring audiences are at the heart of everything the BBC delivers, therefore requiring a range of research providers to support the BBC's market research requirements across all platforms and target audiences.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Community Dermatology Services in Hillingdon
CONTRACT_DESC: Provision of a community dermatology service for patients within Hillingdon CCG. This is a ‘one-stop’ multidisciplinary consultant-led tier 3 clinical assessment and treatment service (CATS). The service treats conditions that cannot be managed by GPs in primary care (i.e. tier 3 dermatology conditions) (Tier 1 and 2 are to be managed by GPs in primary care) and does not cover the tier 4 (cases requiring hospital facility for managing them). It accepts referrals and treat patients of all ages. However, the service excludes any surgical procedures for children under the age of 16, for which patients must be referred to secondary care.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Servicing, Maintenance and Repair of the Static, Portable and Roller Compaction Machines at 13 Recycling and Household Waste Sites (RHWS), Leicestershire
CONTRACT_DESC: Leicestershire County Council operates and manages 13 Recycling and Household Waste (RHWS) operating, on a rota basis, 7 days a week for 52 weeks a year (all sites are closed only on Christmas, Boxing and New Year’s Days). All sites have Husmann compaction equipment, comprising in total, 53 ST-SEL-VZ static, 3 SPB SEL portable and 13 GT 1750 roller compactors.

CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS Supply Chain: Food is operated by Foodbuy Europe Ltd, as agent, for and on behalf of Supply Chain Coordination Ltd (‘SCCL’)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Delivered Ready Prepared Meals 2020
CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Supply Chain: food, seeked to establish a non-exclusive framework agreement for supply and delivery to the NHS Supply Chain customer base via the direct/e-Direct route of chilled and/or frozen meals in 2 lots. The framework agreement will have an initial term of 24 months with an option to extend incrementally for up to a total period of a further 24 months (i.e. 48 months in total). It is anticipated that in the first 12 months of the framework agreement the value of purchases will be in the region of 14 700 000 GBP. For the full 48-month term (if extended) the anticipated value is in the region of 147 000 000 GBP. These values are approximate only and are based on the most recent historical usage information, with a forecasted level of growth. The values provided are for guidance only and are not a guarantee of business.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Home Group Mechanical, Electrical and Public Health Consultant Services Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Home Group is seeking to establish a framework of suitably qualified and experienced Mechanical, Electrical and Public Health (MEP) consultants to support us in the delivery of our ambitious build strategy over the next 4 years. This framework will cover new build and refurbishment projects comprising of a variety of tenures including affordable rent, shared ownership, outright sale and build to rent, as well as the potential to include community and commercial buildings. The framework will exclude the development of new models of care (Extra care and supported) units included within our build programme, however we reserve the right to include these units if part of a large mixed tenure development.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TVDBC — Residential Children’s Homes Provision for Children and Young People
CONTRACT_DESC: Provision of children’s home services for children who are either looked after by the Council or children who have been provided with accommodation under Section 17 and Section 20 of the Children Act 1989. The overall requirement of this contract is that children will be placed with providers who have been registered and approved by Ofsted to provide a secure, warm safe and supportive environment in which they can develop in all aspects of their lives.

CONTRACT_TITLE: NEX17/14 MetroFutures Fleet Replacement Programme
CONTRACT_DESC: As part of its fleet replacement programme, Nexus wishes to procure a new fleet of light rail electric multiple units (New Fleet) to replace its existing Metrocar fleet (Existing Fleet), a maintainer for the new and existing fleets and new depot facilities. The successful bidder will be responsible for the design, construction, testing and delivery of the new fleet pursuant to a manufacturing and supply agreement (MSA). It will enter into a Metrocar Maintenance Agreement (MMA) for maintenance of the existing fleet until removed from service and a train services agreement (TSA) for long-term maintenance of the new fleet including heavy/light maintenance and daily servicing for the design life of the new fleet. It will provide trains to Nexus (as the metro operator) that are ready and safe for entry into service each day. The successful tenderer will also be required to design, construct and deliver new maintenance facilities under a depot construction contract (DCC).

CONTRACT_TITLE: W&W Signal Sighting
CONTRACT_DESC: The supplier shall review signalling scheme plans and produce new signal sighting forms for all new and altered signals/signs. The Supplier shall sight all signs and signal without the use of a 4 D modelling tool.

CONTRACT_TITLE: W&W Signal Sighting
CONTRACT_DESC: The supplier shall review signalling scheme plans and produce new signal sighting forms for all new and altered signals/signs. The Supplier shall sight all signs and signal without the use of a 4 D modelling tool.

CONTRACT_TITLE: London and Quadrant Housing Trust — Multitrade Framework 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant construction services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250 000 people in more than 95 000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Multitrade Services for London and Quadrant’s self delivered new build projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a framework agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for subcontractors only.

CONTRACT_TITLE: 120 kW Solid State RF Amplifier
CONTRACT_DESC: The scope of the contract is to design, manufacture, deliver, install and commission one 500 MHz solid state RF amplifier subject to the performance specification detailed in this document. The amplifier shall be capable of delivering any value of power up to 120 kW in continuous wave operation for extended periods and also of pulsed operation from zero to maximum power at arbitrary duty cycle.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Leisure Management Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Appointment of a contractor for Camden's Leisure Centres management contract.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Contract for Civil Parking anb Traffic Enforcement for London Borough of Camden
CONTRACT_DESC: Contract for civil parking and traffic enforcement for London Borough of Camden.

CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS Ipswich and East Suffolk Clinical Commissioning Group
CONTRACT_TITLE: IESCCG 24 hours ECG Analysis and Reporting Service
CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Ipswich and East Suffolk Clinical Commissioning Group are commissioning a 24 hours ECG analysis and reporting service across the Ipswich and East Suffolk (minus Waveney) locality. The 24 hours ECG reporting and analysis service will enable the referring clinician to electronically upload a 24 hours ECG recording to the provider and receive a specialist interpretation of the 24 hours ECG recording and a clinical outcome for patients with suspected cardiac arrhythmia.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Supply and Fit of Vehicle Tyres to Ubico Ltd
CONTRACT_DESC: Gloucestershire County Council are advertising this opportunity on behalf of Ubico Ltd (the Company). Ubico Ltd is a local authority owned Company set up to deliver environmental services to its primary shareholding Councils through service contracts. The current shareholders are Cheltenham Borough Council, Cotswold District Council, Tewkesbury Borough Council, West Oxfordshire District Council, Forest of Dean District Council, Stroud District Council and Gloucestershire County Council. Ubico operates out of a range of sites throughout Gloucestershire and Oxfordshire.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Physical Education Services and Sports Coaching for Schools — After School Sports Clubs
CONTRACT_DESC: Physical education services and sports coaching for schools — after school sports clubs.

CONTRACT_TITLE: 1920-0001 Islington Breastfeeding Peer Support Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Islington Council sought expressions of interest from providers for a breastfeeding peer support service which aims to increase the prevalence of exclusive breastfeeding at 6-8 weeks and beyond, and reduce inequalities in breastfeeding initiation and continuation.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Manned Security Services at The Royal Mint Site Llantrisant CF72 8YT
CONTRACT_DESC: Provision of manned security services at The Royal Mint Site Llantrisant CF72 8YT.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Tender for the Provision of Early Years Obesity Prevention Training Programme for Practitioners Working with Families/Carers and Children 0 to 5 year Olds
CONTRACT_DESC: The Public Health Agency (PHA) wishes to establish a single provider framework agreement to provide an early years obesity prevention Training programme for practitioners working with families/carers and children 0 to 5 year olds. Note the PHA intends to award an initial contract drawn down from the framework agreement in parallel with the award of the framework agreement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Supply and Delivery of Powered Rescue Equipment
CONTRACT_DESC: Supply of powered rescue equipment to Scottish Fire and Rescue Service.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Framework for Automation Solutions and Specialist Consumables
CONTRACT_DESC: CPI wish to appoint a series of suppliers to support our lab automation requirements, primarily for our formulation business unit based at our Coxon Building facility, through the support of our existing robotic platforms with upgrades, maintenance and ongoing consumable supply and with the provision of new robotic platforms. The scope of supply for equipment purchases under this tender will include the supply and installation of equipment, with the option of commissioning the equipment if required. Purchases may include any design work, packing and shipping, training of users, maintenance, upgrades and ongoing running costs. This tender is split into 4 lots;

CONTRACT_TITLE: The Supply of Repairs and Maintenance Services
CONTRACT_DESC: CVHA is looking to appoint 3 suitably qualified and experienced contractors to a framework agreement to undertake the supply of repairs and maintenance services across CVHA’s housing stock. The contract is for the supply of repairs and maintenance services, with the potential for the inclusion of future small projects. The contract value will be up to a maximum of 1 600 000 GBP per annum.The contract will deliver repairs and maintenance services to around 3 900 tenanted properties, 81 garages and to the common elements of CVHA properties where there is mixed tenure due to the provisions of the Right to Buy legislation. Currently the properties are located within North Lanarkshire and South Lanarkshire areas as outlined in the locality maps above. However, the properties may be located within a wider geographical area in the future.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: National Framework for Major Works 2020 (5 000 000 GBP +)
CONTRACT_DESC: Northumberland Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust are looking to establish a framework of contractors for major works contracts within the UK. The framework will cover projects with a minimum value of 5 000 000 GBP including, but is not limited to: new builds, extensions, refurbishments, housing builds, multi-complex builds, works covering the railway industry, etc. The procurement will be a single stage process following the Public Contract Regulations 2015 open procedure. The framework agreement will be established for a period of 4 years from April 2020, with the option to extend for a further 2 periods of up to 1 year each at the discretion of the contracting authority and subject to satisfactory performance. The framework will be split in to 3 separate lots, which will operate with a maximum of 9 contractors per region per lot. This framework agreement is being advertised and tendered, so it can be utilised by all Public-sector bodies, including Charities in the UK.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Commissioning of a Diversionary Service for West Mercia PCC
CONTRACT_DESC: The West Mercia Diversionary Network has been commissioned on behalf of the Police and Crime Commissioner for West Mercia only, to reduce: the risk of children and young people (C&YP) being exploited and/or the number of C&YP entering the Criminal Justice System (CJS). The trauma some C&YP experience heightens vulnerability, decreasing health and social outcomes and increase their risk of exploitation and entering the criminal justice system. The Diversionary Network will help build resilience in those affected, decreases the risk of victimisation, resulting in a reduction in offending behaviour and ultimately leading to an enriched safer life.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Cambridgeshire County Council Asbestos Removal Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: This procurement process is to identify and appoint a framework of up to 6 service providers to provide a complete asbestos removal service in respect of Cambridgeshire County Council’s property portfolio. The framework will also be open for use by Peterborough City Council. The full range of Asbestos removal services includes encapsulation, environmental clean, asbestos waste collection. Service providers will be required to offer the full range of services. These requirements will not be divided into lots; the requirement is for all providers on the framework to provide the full range of services specified.

CONTRACT_TITLE: ID 2158478 DfE SRC — Provision of Supply and Installation of Audio Visual Equipment and Provision of Support Services for Southern Regional College
CONTRACT_DESC: DfE SRC — provision of supply and installation of audio visual equipment and provision of support services for Southern Regional College. The scope of this contract is to give access to supply, installation and support of audio visual equipment. Initially this will be based on our known requirements in the new builds in Armagh and Banbridge campuses which will allow installation to begin on 18.3.2020 and 15.5.2020 respectively (based on current projected schedule and subject to change, dates may pull forward or push back). A small sample install will be required in advance of these dates for testing purposes. Completion dates will be agreed with the contractor but must be fully completed within 1 month of starting the project on each site. The project in Craigavon plus other refresh work is likely to follow as required and as budget is confirmed.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Supply of Arthroscopy, Sports Medicine Implants and Instruments
CONTRACT_DESC: This tender is to establish a framework for the supply of arthroscopy which includes devices to enable arthroscopic access in a patient. The scope of this tender includes ports and systems required to maintain clear images during a procedure, resection devices and associated consumables for the removal of spurs and soft tissue, all related implants and instrumentation for soft tissue repair or replacement. The successful tenderer will be expected to provide free of charge supporting services such as training, education, clinical support, reporting and cost reduction initiatives.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Cambridgeshire County Council Residential Services for Adults with a Learning Disability
CONTRACT_DESC: Cambridgeshire County Council is commissioning residential services for adults with a learning disability, setting up an open framework for a period of 10 years. This means that the framework will re-open at intervals to allow for new and previously unsuccessful providers to apply to join. Providers must recognise the role they play in ensuring that people with learning disabilities experience the good health and well-being necessary to live a meaningful life. Providers should be aware that there are higher incidences of long term conditions, and other health problems, experienced by people with learning disabilities and prioritises preventative and palliative services and support to minimise potential impacts to service users. As such staff must have sufficient and appropriate training and skills to effectively engage people with learning disabilities in health promotion. The Council is trying to move towards a model that helps people to live as independently as possible at all levels of need, so the focus is on progression. Peterborough City Council may call-off this Framework for service users they have assessed as eligible using their own criteria.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Appointment of a Main Contractor for the Construction of a Learning and Teaching Centre
CONTRACT_DESC: The university wishes to procure a principal contractor for a new Learning and Teaching Centre (LTC) which will be a 7-storey building providing various sizes of teaching rooms for ‘team based learning’ at Brunel University London. The building will include open plan spaces and group study rooms at each level of the building. The design has been developed to RIBA Stage 4 by the universities design team including Penoyre and Prasad Architects and BDP Engineers. The successful contractor will be required to complete the design and the form of contract will be the JCT Design and Build 2016 (with bespoke amendments). The university are not novating the design team but will permit the winning contractor to contact Penoyre and Prasad in relation to completing the architectural design. The value of the contract is in the region of 26 000 000 GBP-4 000 000 GBP .

CONTRACT_TITLE: National Framework for ICT Solutions
CONTRACT_DESC: Added Value Portal Ltd, t/a Pagabo, on behalf of Red Kite Learning Trust, wishes to appoint a number of providers to a framework for the provision of 1:1 learning solutions, tablets, laptops and associated accessories, networking solutions and cloud-based VoIP telephony within the UK for the public sector. The term of this framework agreement will be for a period of 3 years with the option to extend for a further 1 year at the discretion of the central purchasing body and subject to satisfactory performance. This framework agreement is being advertised and tendered, so it can be utilised by all public-sector bodies (including charities) in the UK. Public sector bodies may approach the appointed organisations and either further compete their requirement or PCR 2015 open procedure. CONTRACT_TITLE: ESCC JC Mediation and Disagreement Resolution Service Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: East Sussex County Council is seeking to procure a single supplier framework for the provision of mediation and disagreement resolution services. The Council is acting as lead authority on behalf of the 15 members of the South East Mediation Group. It is anticipated that all members of the South East Mediation Group shall enter into a call-off contract under the framework agreement immediately upon award of the framework agreement. Membership to the South East Mediation Group and access to the framework is open to other authorities covered by NUTS Codes UKH, UKI, UKJ, UKK . The service provider will be expected to provide an impartial and independent service that enables the Council and other contracting authorities to fulfil their statutory duties under the Children and Families Act 2014 concerning special educational provision.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Closed Landfill Sites Maintenance and Monitoring Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Cumbria County Council is responsible for routine gas, leachate, surface water and groundwater monitoring and routine maintenance of a network of closed landfill sites across Cumbria to ensure they are managed and maintained in accordance with legislation. 26 of those landfills are classified as non-permitted with the remaining 8 classified as permitted landfills spread across the County. Not all these sites are owned by the Council, although it remains the duty of the Council under the Environmental Protection Act 1990 Part 2 and Contaminated Land Regulations, to ensure there are no adverse impacts on the environment from any of the sites.

CONTRACT_TITLE: ICT12645 Victoria Coach Station (VCS) Bus Information Display System (BIDS)
CONTRACT_DESC: Victoria Coach Station (VCS) is a subsidiary of Transport for London (TfL). The primary role of the company is to provide an arrivals and departures facility for coaches in London, with off-street setting down and picking-up. Underpinning the operations of VCS is the Bus Information Display System (BIDS), which has been in use at VCS since 1996 and due to its age has a number of functional limitations. Hence TfL are looking to replace the current system with a new system to meet VCS's current and future requirements.

Funding for this project has been awarded through NHSE for an initial 18-month period, it is anticipated that the contract offered will only be for 18 months with the option of extending for a further 18 months. CONTRACT_TITLE: DfI Roads and Rivers – Provision of Fleet Maintenance for Commercial Vehicles over 3 500 kg
CONTRACT_DESC: The Department has a need to establish a call-off contractual arrangement in order to support its in-house maintenance operations. The contract is designed to provide the Department with a facility to have overspill work undertaken which occurs when in-house capacity is not sufficient to meet operational requirements. Please note that as this is a support service for the current in-house Departmental operation, it is not guaranteed that work will be required on all vehicle manufacturer types or models throughout the duration of the contract. The majority of work under this contract will not be pre-booked. Therefore, the appointed contractor(s) will be required to accept work on an ad-hoc basis. Where work has been pre-booked, the Department may need to cancel the booking due to operational requirements at short notice. In these circumstances the Department will not accept any charges for the cancellation.

CONTRACT_TITLE: In Lieu of Short-Term Enablement
CONTRACT_DESC: The In lieu of short-term enablement service is for adults who have been assessed as requiring a period of intermediate care whilst determining their longer term support needs. The service is designed to provide a high quality locality based intermediate care service. The Service will provide flexible, intensive, consistent and integrated short term support to enable an adult to remain at home or return to their normal place of residence. The service will provide support to adults to maximise their independence and achieve their optimum level of function, usually in their own home (but support could also be delivered within other settings including a relative’s home, a residential setting or temporary accommodation), including a rapid response when required. This could be to enable an early and safe transfer from hospital, to prevent admission to hospital, or to meet an immediate support requirement within the community.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Planned Preventative Maintenance and Reactive Maintenance and Minor Works

The contract will also include minor works projects along with building fabric preventative and reactive maintenance services. In addition to the planned maintenance elements of the contract, the contractor will be required to provide a responsive emergency repair service covering all locations, 24 hours per day, 7 days a week.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DE 2197642 Appointment of EOT for Hazelwood Integrated College Newtownabbey

The successfully appointed EOT shall provide the professional services applicable to RIBA (2013) stages 0 to 7 as identified in call for tender contract documentation and information. The EOT shall develop the design to RIBA (2013) stage 3 exemplar developed design before appointing and managing an integrated supply team (IST) to further develop the detail/technical design and deliver the project throughout all remaining RIBA Plan of Work (2013) stages 4 to 7. For a complete description of this procurement please refer to CfT contract documents and draft scope of services. Price aspect will be assessed using the Narrow Average.

CONTRACT_DESC: Portsmouth and Fareham and Gosport South East Hampshire CCG and Portsmouth CCG are direct awarding a Paediatric Psychiatric Liaison Services contract to ensure continuity of service from 1 April 2020 to Solent NHS Trust for a period of 5 years. The continuity given by using the same provider has enabled a period of time for commissioners and providers to work together through a period of co-design, involving a series of structured developments and testing of varied delivery models in-line with both national requirements as well as linked with local service transformations. Due to the complexity of the service, there are a limited number of providers locally in the market. Other options have been explored with alternative providers; however this has been declined due to limited capacity. This award is for a period of 5 years will total GBP 1 309 575; due to potential activity fluctuation and demand forecast, the value is estimated to be between GBP 1.3 million-GBP 1.5 million.

The successfully appointed EOT shall provide the professional services applicable to RIBA (2013) Stages 0 to 7 as identified in call for tender contract documentation and information.The EOT shall develop the design to RIBA (2013) Stage 3 exemplar developed design before appointing and managing an Integrated supply team (IST) to further develop the detail/technical design and deliver the project throughout all remaining RIBA Plan of Work (2013) Stages 4 to 7. The contract will be awarded to the E0T which has submitted the most economically advantageous tender (MEAT) using the narrow average price scoring mechanism — refer to draft ITT Document 1 of 4. CONTRACT_TITLE: The Princess Alexandra Hospital Energy Procurement Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Princess Alexandra Hospital NHS Trust is an acute Trust located in Essex. The Trust currently uses approximately 15 GWh of gas and 10 GWh of electricity annually. The Trust is looking to appoint a supplier to work with over the coming years enabling the control of the commodity price exposure through a flexible procurement solution. It is envisaged that this will comprise a 36-month contract with an option to extend by 12 months a maximum of two times, this option will be at the sole discretion of the Trust. Only suppliers holding the relevant Ofgem supply licenses will be eligible for receipt of the tender documentation, copies may be required as evidence of eligibility prior to documentation being sent out.

CONTRACT_BUYER: European Centre for Medium-range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Copernicus C3S_428 C3S Use Cases (Round 4)
CONTRACT_DESC: This invitation to tender (ITT) aimed at selecting use cases to bring about success stories of the uptake of the Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) products to spin-up sustainable applications and businesses. Based on a market analysis, the contractor will develop and demonstrate an end-to-end application based on C3S products and the tools provided by the Climate Data Store (CDS) infrastructure. The objective of such contracts is to create downstream applications at the service of users based on C3S data and the associated infrastructure.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Silvertown Tunnel Project

It is proposed that user charging will be applied to manage congestion and help fund the scheme, although this will not form part of the contract.

CONTRACT_DESC: NEUPC has awarded a framework agreement which is for the provision of data centre management equipment and infrastructure products and related services. Products in scope include a range of data centre management equipment and infrastructure including but not limited to Uninterrupted Power Supplies (UPS), cooling equipment, generators, gas and fire suppression systems, power distribution units (PDU’s), blanking panels, caging. Any or all elements of the supply, Installation and management of data centre equipment and infrastructure may be bought via the framework. See ITT.

CONTRACT_DESC: The Police and Crime Commissioner for Gwent was the previous lead on a nationally available Police framework agreement for the provision of the destruction and disposal of protectively Marked Waste. The framework was available to all 43 police forces and 22 of other Public Sector Organisations within the UK. 10 police forces and 2 other Public Sector Organisations utilised that framework agreement. The Commissioner intends to replace the Gwent Police framework with another nationally available framework agreement for the provision of the destruction and disposal of protectively marked waste.

DFID Malawi intends to work with suppliers who are committed to improving the quality education in Malawi and strengthening government systems for long lasting sustainability.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DoJ 1193307 — Maintenance of Specialist Security Services for the Northern Ireland Prison Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The contracting authority is seeking to procure a single economic operator (Contractor) to lead a team of specialist subcontractors for the provision of servicing and maintenance of specialist security systems services across the Northern Ireland Prison Service estate utilising an NEC3 term service short contract. The contract is for the provision of planned preventative, reactive maintenance and the essential replacement of equipment for access control, locking systems, staff alarm systems, CCTV systems, fire alarm, electro hydaulic gates and turnstiles, cell call, intercom, perimeter detection, key management and pegging systems across NI Prison Service sites. In addition to the sites indicated above, other occasional services may also be required (subject to the approval of the Northern Ireland Prison Service) to be undertaken for other Agencies or Arms length bodies of the Department of Justice (NI) within the boundaries of Northern Ireland.

CONTRACT_TITLE: London and Quadrant Housing Trust — Environmental Impact Assessor Framework 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant construction services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250 000 people in more than 95 000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Environmental Impact Assessors for London and Quadrant’s Self delivered new build projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a framework agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for service providers only.

CONTRACT_TITLE: C001740 Executive Coaching Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Education for Scotland plans to establish a quality assured framework of executive coaches within NHS Scotland. This framework will supersede the current executive coaching register administered by NES. The framework will support national leadership priorities and national leadership development programmes, as well as providing a national resource for individual NHS Scotland Boards and potentially other public sector bodies, to draw on for their executive coaching needs.

CONTRACT_DESC: This framework (‘the Framework Agreement’) is for the supply (with an element of design) and delivery of street lighting LED luminaires and associated fittings and spares to support Durham County Council LED Luminaire Replacement programme and to cover capital and maintenance works. CONTRACT_TITLE: DoF — Collaborative Arrangement — Provision of Metered Electricity 2020 (ID 2247464)
CONTRACT_DESC: This contract will be for the supply of metered electricity for a term of 24 months. The anticipated commencement date shall be 1 April 2020 and expire on 31 March 2022. The contract will be divided into two lots. It is anticipated two contracts will be awarded from this tender competition. Lot 1 will be used by the clients listed in table 1 of the specification of requirements. Lot 2 is for Translink only.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Origin Housing Ltd — National Electricity and Gas Procurement Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Origin Housing Ltd seeks to establish a multi-supplier, multi-lot framework to enable housing, education and other public sector bodies/bodies governed by public law to access electricity and gas purchasing solutions via a competitive call off process. Origin Housing Ltd will be utilising the services of its energy partner to facilitate the call-off process according to individual needs and requirements.

CONTRACT_TITLE: QUB/1821/19 Contract for Clinical Research Services (Clinical Research Organisation)
CONTRACT_DESC: Queen's seeks to appoint a clinical research organisation (CRO) to provide services in respect of managing a Phase I Clinical Trial sponsored by Polyphor AG (the Sponsor). CRO services are required to conduct a Phase I study in Healthy Volunteers. The trial is operating under the Innovative Medicines Initiative (IMI) which is Europe's largest public-private initiative aiming to speed up the development of better and safer medicines for patients (http://www.imi.europa.eu/). Applications are invited from firms capable of managing Phase I Clinical Trials and all associated services. The appointed CRO will be responsible for clinical services, site management, monitoring, (unblinded) pharmacy, data management, study recruitment, clinical project management, statistics and medical writing (Clinical Study report). A central safety laboratory will be provided by the CRO.

CONTRACT_TITLE: NCC023 Alternative Education
CONTRACT_DESC: Alternative education refers to the operation of programmes of learning and skills development in non-school settings with the aim of supporting the progression of students who have become disengaged or are at risk of being disengaged from school-based education.

CONTRACT_BUYER: North of England Commercial Procurement Collaborative (NOE CPC) (hosted by and acting through Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust.)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Soft Facilities Management Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The purpose of this procurement is to establish a framework for the provision of soft facilities management services. The service areas covered are, but not limited to catering, pest control, car parking and traffic management, cleaning, drain cleaning and maintenance, window cleaning, deep cleaning, ground maintenance and winter gritting and a full soft FM managed service. The framework is intended to provide a one stop shop for organisations soft FM requirements, with suppliers selected for their experience and ability to provide customers with a comprehensive range of services and works that combine quality and value and compliance. A call-off order may be placed by direct award, or following a further competition.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Firefighting Equipment and Associated Services
CONTRACT_DESC: NEUPC is seeking to award a framework agreement for the provision of firefighting equipment and associated services with the scope covering a range of products including, but not limited to, fire extinguishers, fire blankets, storage, first aid equipment, door furniture, escape equipment, signage and wireless alarms. The associated services lot will be for the provision of fire safety training and fire risk assessments. This agreement will be open to universities and their partners regardless of whether or not they are to be defined as contracting authorities for the purpose of the PCR 2015. It is anticipated that some of the future call off contracts under this framework may be part funded from external streams, including European Union (EU) funding and (ERDF/ESF) and potentially other research bodies. All funding assessed under this framework will be considered compliant for the purposes of external funding by the named participants.
