CONTRACT_TITLE: Buildings Insurance for Residential Leaseholders
CONTRACT_DESC: The provision of buildings insurance for residential leasehold properties sold under right to buy legislation. The Council currently effects cover for 1 183 right to buy leasehold properties, however it is anticipated that this figure could increase by up to 2 % by the commencement date of the contract. The number of properties to be insured may also decrease because leaseholders have the right to enfranchisement when the ratio of leaseholders to Council tenants reaches two thirds and at least 50 % of the leaseholders wish to exercise this right. Properties are to be insured on a blanket basis, without selection, irrespective of location or previous claims history and inclusion under the policy will be automatic on completion of sale.

CONTRACT_TITLE: SSD 19 07 Derbyshire Community Lives Directory – Day Services for Derbyshire

CONTRACT_TITLE: Consultants Framework Agreement for Housing Development
CONTRACT_DESC: Havebury Housing Partnership wishes to procure a framework agreement following which it is envisaged that contracts will be let to consultants within the framework for the provision of a range of consultancy services in support of its Housing Development programme; which is estimated to be approximately 40 schemes/600 dwellings over a 4-year period. The proposed framework agreement is for a maximum of 4 years, however contracts entered into under the Agreement may continue, where appropriate, beyond its duration.

CONTRACT_TITLE: ITT for Care and Support at 508 Seaside Eastbourne
CONTRACT_DESC: 508 Seaside is an established supported housing scheme built on the original site of St Anthony’s Court Seaside Road Eastbourne a former residential care home for older people. This scheme is part of the East Sussex County Council (ESCC) Adult Social Care (ASC) supported housing and bedded care programme. It houses two ASC client groups. It was the first supported housing scheme to be developed in East Sussex for people with physical disabilities and one of three schemes developed to support people with mental health support needs. Funding for the scheme has been provided by Saxon Weald Homes Ltd and East Sussex County Council. The aim of the service is to increase the opportunities and improve the quality of life of vulnerable people by providing accessible high quality and affordable supported housing that enables independent living and provides an alternative to residential care as part of wider existing and new housing health and social care services.

SUPPLIER_NAME: A G Axton and Sons (Wholesale) Ltd
CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS Supply Chain: Food is operated by Foodbuy Europe Limited, as agent, for and on behalf of Supply Chain Coordination Limited (‘SCCL’)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Distribution of Fruit and Vegetables under the School Fruit and Vegetable Scheme
CONTRACT_DESC: The distribution, storage and management of fruit and vegetables products under the School Fruit and Vegetable Scheme (‘DISFVS’) is a Government funded initiative that supplies a piece of fruit or vegetable to all key stage 1 children (ages 4-7) in England for consumption up to 190 days each academic year — (the ‘proposed product Lines’) and distribution to schools within England (the ‘Customer(s)’). Currently over 16 600 primary schools (circa 2 300 000 children) take part in the scheme in England.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Taxi and Small Bus Services — Further Competition -DN459988
CONTRACT_DESC: This tender was a further competition from an existing DPS. Kingston upon Hull City Council sought providers to supply and deliver transport services for education and social care. The authority established a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) for the provision of its transport services with suitably qualified operators of Private Hire, Hackney Carriage and PSV/PCV vehicles. The authority will enter into contract(s) for periods of 2 to 4 years, dependant on the category of vehicle, with options to extend up to 12-month. Such extensions will be at the discretion of the authority and subject to satisfactory performance. Lots and individual routes were tendered. Only organisations on the taxi and small bus services DPS were invited to tender. The authority tended 50 standalone routes, 4 call-off (ad-hoc) Bransholme Area, North Hull Area, East Hull Area and West Hull Area ad-hoc contracts) and 13 lots (containing grouped routes).

The authority established a dynamic purchasing system (DPS) for the provision of its transport services with suitably qualified operators of Private Hire, Hackney Carriage and PSV/PCV vehicles. The authority will enter into contract(s) for periods of 2 to 4 years, dependant on the category of vehicle, with options to extend up to 12-month. Such extensions will be at the discretion of the authority and subject to satisfactory performance. Lots and individual routes were tendered. Only organisations on the taxi and small bus services DPS were invited to tender. The authority tended 50 standalone routes, 4 call-off (ad-hoc) Bransholme Area, North Hull Area, East Hull Area and West Hull Area ad-hoc contracts) and 13 lots (containing grouped routes).

CONTRACT_DESC: The contract will deliver various datasets containing: modelled fuel bills and incomes, splits by various socio-demographic and housing characteristics, modelled benefit variables and indicators of eligibility and uptake of Government policies such as Warm Home Discount (WHD) and the Energy Company Obligations (ECO). CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Annual Support for National Application Infrastructure Service — NHAIS
CONTRACT_DESC: National Health Application and Infrastructure Service (NHAIS) is a system that has been developed by the NHSfor the sole use of the NHS to help manage primary care patient registrations, practitioner payments, population screening and other services. DXC took over support of NHAIS in Northern Ireland in 2018 and are now the only supplier with the relevant skills and knowledge required to support this system. BSO run a customised version of the software in Northern Ireland to better meet the needs of the services they provide.

CONTRACT_TITLE: LNE&EM Route Digital Transformation Railway Systems Integration Partner (RSIP)
CONTRACT_DESC: Network Rail (NR) is seeking to establish a single supplier framework to undertake the role of a Railway Systems Integration Partner (RSIP) for digital transformation of the London North East and East Midlands(LNE&EM) Route as part of the NR Digital Railway Programme (DRP). It is envisaged that the RSIP will work in a co-located and integrated team with the LNE&EM Route and its train control and traffic management technology partners, to deliver industry change, specific programme outcomes and customer benefits. This will include coordinating the railway industry (section II.2.4) in preparation for the step change presented by the introduction of digital technologies, including train control and traffic management systems.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Worcestershire Drug and Alcohol Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Worcestershire County Council is commissioning an integrated drug and alcohol specialist treatment service for young people and adults living in Worcestershire, in partnership with West Mercia Police and Crime Commissioner. Drug and alcohol misuse have the potential to cause increased risk of harm to individuals, those closest to them and wider society. The primary purpose of the drug and alcohol service is to reduce drug and alcohol related harm and promote recovery. This will be achieved by working together in partnership with service users and stakeholders in the wider health and care system. Essential to this new service are: The contract duration will be for a period of 5 years – 1 April 2020 – 31 March 2025.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Building and Public Conveniences Cleaning Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Council office and Council-owned public conveniences cleaning services includes: Regular cleaning of Elizabeth House (the Council's main offices located in Stratford-upon-Avon), opening and closing and regular cleaning of 12 public conveniences (6 in Stratford-upon-Avon and 6 located across the district of Stratford-on-Avon in outlying towns and villages), occasional cleaning, opening and closing of other buildings owned by Stratford-on-Avon District Council, i.e. Sports Pavilion in Stratford-upon-Avon. Contract is 4 years (with the option of an additional 4 year contract extension), commencing on 2 June 2020.

CONTRACT_TITLE: CWC19112 — Home Care Wolverhampton
CONTRACT_DESC: The City of Wolverhampton Council is seeking providers for the provision of new domiciliary care services for older people and adults with disabilities. The specification has three-main service elements: domiciliary care, rapid response and home-based respite for carers. Providers are expected to be able to deliver all or some of these elements. The Council will operate a flexible framework with 3 tiers of provider and a mix of area based ‘Lead’ provider and city-wide coverage. Inclusion on the framework will also provide occasional access to related special projects, pilots and help commissioners reduce ‘spot’ purchases. The framework is dynamic and will periodically open to allow new providers to join and for existing providers to amend their service offer. Minimum selection criteria will apply. Refer to the tender documents for further information. Contract term — 3 years plus up to two further 3-years, up to May 2028. Procedure — ‘Light Touch Regime’.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Financial Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The NWUPC is seeking to establish a multi-provider framework agreement on behalf of the members of NWUPC, NEUPC, LUPC, SUPC and HEPCW for financial services. This framework agreement will commence on 1 August 2019 for an initial period of 24 months until 31 July 2021 with the option to extend the agreement for 12 months until 31 July 2022 and a further 12 months until 31 July 2023 subject to satisfactory economic operator performance. https://www.nwupc.ac.uk/our-members http://www.hepcw.ac.uk/files/2016/01/HEPCW-Members1.pdf https://www.lupc.ac.uk/member-list http://www.neupc.ac.uk/our-members https://www.supc.ac.uk/about-us/our-members/our-members

CONTRACT_TITLE: Essex Construction Framework 2
CONTRACT_DESC: Essex County Council (ECC) are looking to establish a 4-year Framework Agreement for principal contractors to carry out both design and construction and construction only works primarily on behalf of ECC. The main driver for demand within ECC is the capital programme to expand the number of school places across the county, valued at GBP 35 000 000 – GBP 50 000 000 per annum. The Framework Agreement is anticipated to be utilised as a route for any construction project delivered by ECC (excluding roads and housing). The Framework consists of 3 core lots and will be available to other Contracting Authorities. The Selection Questionnaire will use the PAS 91:2017 questionnaire, with the inclusion of ECC specific questions. A bidders event will be held at 13.30 on April 1

CONTRACT_TITLE: Essex Construction Framework 2
CONTRACT_DESC: Essex County Council (ECC) are looking to establish a 4-year Framework Agreement for principal contractors to carry out both design and construction and construction only works primarily on behalf of ECC. The main driver for demand within ECC is the capital programme to expand the number of school places across the county, valued at GBP 35 000 000 – GBP 50 000 000 per annum. The Framework Agreement is anticipated to be utilised as a route for any construction project delivered by ECC (excluding roads and housing). The Framework consists of 3 core lots and will be available to other Contracting Authorities. The Selection Questionnaire will use the PAS 91:2017 questionnaire, with the inclusion of ECC specific questions. A bidders event will be held at 13.30 on April 1

CONTRACT_TITLE: South MRT — Package 4
CONTRACT_DESC: South Reading MRT is a series of bus priority measures on the A33 corridor between Mereoak Park and Ride and Reading town center. The scheme will reduce congestion and journey times, improve the attractiveness of public transport through enhanced frequency and reliability, and enable sustainable economic and housing development on the main growth corridor into Reading. The scheme comprises of carriageway widening works to accommodate the new MRT (bus) southbound lane and associated and proposed foot way / cycleway on the A33. Work includes but is not limited to new road construction, alterations to the surface water drainage, street lighting, statutory utilities diversions, road restraint systems, sheet piling and the addition of a new northbound bus stop lay-by. Traffic signal upgrades are also proposed at the A33 Island Road Junction and A33 Bennet Road Junction. Furthermore, the works also include the relocation of a northbound bus lane and the addition of a southbound bus stop.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Total Hospital Bed Management
CONTRACT_DESC: The Trust is seeking to establish a total managed bed and mattress service with a third-party provider for the supply, management and maintenance of its bed and pressure relieving equipment.

Since 2016 Alperton Community School has been ranked in the first quintile (highest category) in all areas e.g. most able students, lower attaining students, pupil premium. As a result, the school has been graded ‘above average’ and ‘well above average’ in the DfE performance tables for the last 3 years. We work hard to ensure that learning takes place in a culture of mutual respect. We expect nothing less than exemplary student behaviour and attitudes to learning at all times. We believe that all students can succeed and exceed expectations through hard work and commitment. We aspire to achieve these objectives, by delivering high quality teaching and learning.’

CONTRACT_TITLE: Decoration and Minor Pre-decoration Repairs Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Hampshire County Council undertakes a large and varied programme of work involving maintenance, new build, rationalisation and refurbishment of the Council's and its clients built estate. The main areas of activity in relation to this procurement comprises individual projects or programmes of external and internal decoration works and pre-decoration repairs including joinery and window repairs, clearing flat roofs of moss and debris with gullies cleaned and rainwater goods checked to make sure outlets are free-running. Provision of scaffold and access equipment as required. Painting walls, ceilings, doors and anything previously painted and cleaning any pre-finished items within rooms. This may include replacing carpets.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Anchor Hanover Group Construction Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Anchor Hanover Group (AHG) is seeking to establish a multi contractor framework agreement for the provision of construction works for predominately new build developments of approx 80 units, but may also include infill extensions and refurbishments at existing housing schemes in 6 geographical lots. The framework will be available for use for project values from approximately 1 000 000 GBP up to over 25 000 000 GBP plus for specialist retirement housing. The framework will commence in January 2020 and be available for all types of construction — primarily design and build arrangements utilising the JCT 2016 design build form of contract with bespoke contract amendments. Call-off contracts may be carried out either based on a direct award, or on the basis of a mini-competition. Call-offs will be managed in accordance with the selection procedure and mini-competition rules under the framework agreement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TD1435 — DPS Transport Services for Hackney Carriage, Minibus and Private Hire Vehicles
CONTRACT_DESC: Derby City Council were seeking to establish a dynamic purchasing system (DPS), of organisations able to provide transport services including home-to-school, special education needs and social care transport. The purpose of this procurement was to establish the DPS agreement between the Council and the service provider(s) for the provision of transport services. Under this agreement, transport is provided using hackney carriage, minibus and private hire vehicles. Vehicles are of various capacities (minimum four seats and upwards and in accordance with current public service vehicle (PSV) legislation or private hire or hackney carriage legislation.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TC939 Provision of Telephony/Unified Communications
CONTRACT_DESC: Manchester City Council’s current telephony system becomes end of life in 2019. In addition, there is no upgrade path available for the existing platform that supports the organisation’s approach to new ways of working and increased flexibility/agility and, as a result, there isn’t a result a path which aligns to the ICT Strategy. In order to align the telephony solution to the ICT Strategy the Council is looking to procure a new, supported, secure and flexible telephony platform. In line with the ICT Strategy direction and principles to adopt a ‘CloudFirst’ approach, the Council requires the new solution to be provided via a Software as a Service (SaaS) model.

CONTRACT_DESC: Thirteen are looking to procure a Framework contract to provide support to the Investment and Maintenance In-House Teams on an ‘as and when’ basis during periods of peak workload. The specific work types have been split into separate packages (Lots). These services shall fall into five ‘Lots’ reflecting the area of support needed for the business. Thirteen seek to appoint up to five contractors per lot, on an ‘as required basis’ to support and supplement the in-house team in their day to day works and out of hours emergencies.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Licencing, Development, Support and Maintenance
CONTRACT_DESC: Hematos is a blood donor and patient testing system, supporting the bulk of NHSBT’s diagnostic and therapeutic services (DTS) directorate. As a system it records immuno‐genetic test data including red cell, HLA and HPA types to support all of the DTS ‘Specialist Services’ functions: red cell immunohaematology, international blood group reference laboratory, histocompatibility and immunogenetics, cellular and molecular therapies, stem cell donation and transplantation (SCDT). Hematos additionally supports the national bacteriology laboratory (NBL). In the SCDT function hematos is used to support the collection, processing and distribution of stem cell and cord blood products and the creation and maintenance of a searchable registry of potential adult bone marrow/stem cell donors and a searchable bank of cord blood donations. Hematos is critical to all aspects of business as usual within DTS and to the delivery of the strategic plans for 2014-20.

CONTRACT_TITLE: CPF1843-19 Devon Maintenance Panel Agreement 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: Devon County Council (DCC) has a significant property estate which comprises many buildings located throughout the geographic area of Devon. The MPA will operate in each of 10 geographical sub areas within Devon. The framework contract will provide for booking of all rail and air travel tickets, all hotel accommodation and any other ancillary requirements related to business travel. NEPO507 is to be a single provider solution which will replace the existing framework contract for travel management services expiring 31 July 2020.

CONTRACT_DESC: This is a contract award notice for the direct award of the existing end of life care services contract to the current provider, Earl Mountbatten Hospice. The CCG’s investment in this provision is GBP 3 059 212 per annum (19/20 value) and will include the discharge coordinator role which has been previously been funded separately while proof of concept was established. It is proposed that the length of the contract will be 5 years with the option to extend up to 5 years, commencing 1 April 2020.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TD1529 — Preventative and Universal Services for Carers
CONTRACT_DESC: Derby City Council and NHS Derby and Derbyshire Clinical Commissioning Group (DDCCG) are prioritising support for carers as the needs of carers are often cross cutting in terms of health and social care. The services being commissioned aims to involve carers in identifying their needs, assist them to remain in their caring role, ensure their individual outcomes are achieved and their well-being is maintained.

CONTRACT_TITLE: WSCC Library Kiosk Replacement Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The County Council requires a service provider to: replace the existing estate of self-service kiosks with 70 new kiosks and install the new kiosks in libraries throughout the county. Provide the relevant software for the kiosks in compliance with the technical requirements in Appendix 2 provide on-going maintenance and support services for a period of 5 years. Complete the full replacement programme ready for public use by 1 April 2020, including disposal of the current kiosks. Full details can be found in document 2 — service specification.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Football Foundation Artificial Grass Pitch (AGP) Consultant Framework 2020
CONTRACT_DESC: The contracting authority has established a multiple provider ‘Manufacturer-led’ framework to deliver artificial grass pitches (AGP). The contracting authority will act as funder for applicants who will come from primarily public sector. Two single provider frameworks have been established with one consultant in each lot.

CONTRACT_TITLE: WHC — Minster House Redevelopment
CONTRACT_DESC: Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council is embarking on a project known as the Minster Close Redevelopment. The site is located at Minister Close, Hatfield, AL10 9JN. The scope of the project is to demolish the existing buildings which comprise 29 flats and 11 bungalows of sheltered housing accommodation and build a state of the art modern sheltered housing scheme comprising 90+ residential units, guest units, external hard and soft landscaping, below ground drainage and services. A two stage procurement process is being adopted and this invitation to tender and the other supporting documents form the first stage where the bidders are requested to provide priced preliminaries and pre-construction design and other services, overheads and profit ready for a stage 2 negotiated contract. The contractor would be appointed at the end of the first stage process and be required to enter into a 'Pre-Construction Service Agreement'.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Convex Software Platform and Provider
CONTRACT_DESC: The primary aim of the ConVEx facility is to create an open access marketplace for the safe, secure, simple and sustainable exchange of data to facilitate innovation in the development and deployment of CAVs and thereby to support cities or regions in achieving goals for safer, cleaner, more affordable and more effective mobility. It will assist the growth of CAV development in the UK by enabling cost effective access to CAV-relevant data for SMEs and smaller organisations but it will also encourage inward investment by the creation of a platform that can accelerate CAV R&D for organisations of all sizes. Furthermore, it will support strategic and regulatory decision making by local, regional and national bodies around the deployment of CAV services.

CONTRACT_TITLE: 2393/DM — Fischer-Tropsch Plant
CONTRACT_DESC: We are setting up a National Translational Energy Research Centre (TERC) and are looking to procure a wide range of new equipment focusing on bio-energy, renewable energy and carbon capture, utilisation and storage (CCUS) technologies. Flue gas from all combustion systems will be integrated into the on-site carbon capture plants. The captured CO2 will be utilised in an on-site Fischer–Tropsch plant along with hydrogen generated on-site from renewable resources in order to produce green fuel for use in the turbines/engines for full-chain CCUS demonstration. As part of the equipment portfolio we are looking to procure a Fischer–Tropsch plant for aviation fuel production to broaden and support our extensive research, development and deployment activities at the centre. The plant will take CO2 and H2 from storage and convert it to aviation liquid fuels.

CONTRACT_TITLE: National Framework for Professional Services in Construction and Premises 2020
CONTRACT_DESC: The Education Alliance have awarded a framework of consultants for professional services in construction and premises. The framework will cover projects including, but not limited to, new builds, extensions, refurbishments, housing builds, multi-complex builds, works covering the railway industry, infrastructure projects, etc. The procurement was a single stage process following the PCR 2015 Open Procedure. The framework agreement has been established for 3 years from 12 April 2020, with an option to extend for a further period of 1 year. This framework agreement was advertised and tendered, so it can be utilised by all public-sector bodies, including Charities in the UK. The full list is available in the tender synopsis on the In-Tend portal — https://in-tendhost.co.uk/pagabo/aspx/home Public sector bodies as outlined above who may wish to access this framework at some future date may either directly appoint or further compete their requirement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Sensor Monitoring Equipment for Domestic Properties
CONTRACT_DESC: The Council requires a single contractor to supply an end to end service to monitor the internal environmental conditions (including temperature, humidity and Co2 levels) within domestic properties owned by the Council. The contractor must provide all environmental sensors, supply, installation and maintenance of a LoRaWan network or equivalent for connection to a software system and a software as a service system to provide the Council with data, reports and analysis of any environmental data collected including recommendations on a per property basis. Environmental sensors provided must be small, discrete and unobtrusive with no pilot lights or active light and no greater surface than a standard wall light switch. Sensors should be provided with suitable fixings to be securely fixed to walls/ceilings, will be battery powered and tamper -proof. The Council’s in-house team will install the sensors and the contractor will provide appropriate warranties to support this requirement.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Multi-disciplinary Design Consultancy Services for King Henry, St Michael’s Old and St Michael’s New Building Refurbishment
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Portsmouth approved an estate masterplan framework in November 2016 setting out its aspirations for the longer-term development of the estate. One of the early projects identified within the masterplan is the refurbishment of King Henry, St Michael’s Old and St Michael’s new buildings. The University has appointed a multi-disciplinary design team to develop the brief and provide full design services for the project. The estimated construction cost of the project is GBP 16 m. A design solution that addresses the buildings’ condition survey will be the first priority, consideration will also be required around the science faculty requirements. It is of great importance that these are delivered within what is a finite budget.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Disabled Facilities Grant (DFG) Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: The Disabled Facilities Grant (DFG) is a mandatory Government grant administered by local councils and funds a range of works that will help disabled individuals remain in their home. ENGIE's DFG Technical Team on behalf of North East Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) is seeking suitably qualified contractors for their new DFG Framework. The framework will deliver the authority's disabled facilities grants, which provides essential adaptations to give disabled individuals better freedom of movement around the house, emergency grants to home owner occupiers unable to finance emergency repairs and home appreciation loans to eligible home owner occupiers to allow them to bring the property up to a Decent Homes Standard.

CONTRACT_TITLE: WHC — Tewin Road (Welwyn Garden City) Redevelopment
CONTRACT_DESC: Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council (hereinafter referred to as the Council) is embarking on a project to redevelop Tewin Road Depot The site is currently utilised by the Council as a streetscene depot (including waste collection, cleansing and grounds maintenance across the borough). The Council in collaboration with Hertfordshire County Council are seeking to redevelop the site and replace the Cole Green Household Waste Recycling Centre currently located close to the borough. The streetscene contractors will need to operate out of the depot during the works and the successful contractor will need to develop a phasing plan with the interested parties to enable this to happen.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Emergency Accommodation for Residents in Temporary Accommodation during Covid -19 Pandemic
CONTRACT_DESC: A direct procurement with two hotel groups, Britannia and Travelodge was required due to the urgent need to house hostel residents that currently share facilities in Camden's hostel pathway. Residents are currently housed in various hostels located across the borough in numerous locations. However, due to the circumstances, where many of the resident share facilities, a new arrangement has been sought to re-house the approximately 150-220 residents who are deemed the highest medical risk of contracting Covid-19.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Tax Advisory and Related Services Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Scottish Enterprise (SE) and South of Scotland Enterprise (SoSE) are looking to establish a framework to deliver on tax advisory and related services and will operate as a single supplier framework. Procurement of the services will cover the provision of advice known and anticipated tax consequences which flow from SE and SoSE activities. It is anticipated that this framework will commence on 1 April 2020 for a period of 3 years, with an option to extend for a further period of 12 months.

CONTRACT_TITLE: SSAPR20024 Charter of MS Hebridean Sky
CONTRACT_DESC: This is for the urgent charter of the MS Hebridean Sky operated by Noble Caledonia, due to the COVID-19 emergency. The Covid-19 emergency has hugely disrupted the planned arrangements to return personnel from Falkland Islands to the UK in a manner that was not foreseeable, and there is an immediate need to place this contract to secure safe board and passage for the staff. Staff working in the Antarctic region who would normally return to the UK via the Falkland Islands, would usually make use of the MoD Air Bridge to return to the UK. MoD advise the Airbridge is now prioritised for medical and other emergency staff and in addition its normal routing is compromised.

CONTRACT_TITLE: HQIP NCA 2059 Child Health Clinical Outcome Review Programme
CONTRACT_DESC: The Child Health Clinical Outcome Review Programme was first commissioned by HQIP in 2015 and has been delivered to date by The National Confidential Enquiry into Patient Outcome and Death (NCEPOD) team. The Child Health Clinical Outcome Review Programme is one of four Clinical Outcome Review Programmes (previously known as confidential enquiries) which are designed to help assess the quality of healthcare and stimulate improvement in safety and effectiveness by systematically enabling clinicians, managers and policy makers to learn from adverse events and other relevant data. The Child Health Clinical Outcome and Review Programme is commissioned by the Healthcare Quality Improvement Partnership (HQIP) on behalf of NHS England, Welsh Government, the Scottish Government, the Northern Ireland Department of Health and the States of Jersey, Guernsey and the Isle of Man. The successful bidder will build on the experiences and achievements of the programme since its inception.

CONTRACT_DESC: Crown Commercial Services (CCS), the Authority, has put into place a single lot national framework agreement for the provision of training estate services for use by the Ministry of Defence, it’s agencies including Defence Infrastructure Organisation (DIO) and other UK public sector bodies and future successor organisations, which include Central Government Departments, Arms Length Bodies and Agencies, NDPBs, NHS and Local Authorities. CCS aims to allow procuring departments the ability to enter into call-off contracts of various sizes and complexity.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Cabinet Office, acting through an expert committee of the Cabinet Office, Geospatial Commission
CONTRACT_TITLE: Public Sector Geospatial Agreement
CONTRACT_DESC: The contracting authority has entered into an agreement with Royal Mail Group Ltd under which Royal Mail will continue to grant a licence to public sector bodies in England and Wales for the use of their intellectual property contained in their postcode address file (PAF), multiple residence (MR), and Not Yet Built (NYB) datasets. The terms of this licence cover the public sectors use of the Royal Mail’s intellectual property in products and solutions provided by Royal Mail solution providers and as such does not require public sector bodies to pay any royalties associated with the use of PAF, MR or NYB within the third party solutions or datasets. It is not a direct supply agreement and therefore does not make provision for Royal Mail to directly supply data to the public sector.

CONTRACT_TITLE: HR and Finance Systems Transformation
CONTRACT_DESC: The current core and peripheral Human Resources (HR) and Finance Systems of Norfolk County Council (‘the Authority’) have been in place for 14 years and in their current form constrain the transformation of services and delivery of savings. The Authority has purchased system implementation services and an integrated software as a service (SaaS) HR and Finance System with a ‘go live’ date of October 2021.

CONTRACT_TITLE: HR and Finance Systems Transformation
CONTRACT_DESC: The current core and peripheral Human Resources (HR) and Finance Systems of Norfolk County Council (‘the Authority’) have been in place for 14 years and in their current form constrain the transformation of services and delivery of savings. The Authority has purchased system implementation services and an integrated software as a service (SaaS) HR and Finance System with a ‘go live’ date of October 2021.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Open Framework for the Provision of Older Adults Residential and Nursing Care Services
CONTRACT_DESC: From time to time as part of the commissioning process, the Council needs to re-contract providers of residential and nursing care. The Council is therefore launching the ‘Open Framework for the Provision of Older Adults Residential and Nursing Care Services’, a new contract for providers of older adults residential and nursing care services. Via this new contract, the Council is aiming to support the provider market to develop the increasingly complex residential and nursing care services required to meet the changing needs of the Cumbrian population.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Open Framework for Support Services for Option 2, 3 and 4
CONTRACT_DESC: The social care (self-directed support) Scotland Act places a duty on local authority social work departments to offer people who are eligible for social care, a range of choices over how they receive their social care and support. This contract involves option 2: funding is allocated to a provider of choice and option 3: the Council can select and arrange appropriate support on behalf of the eligible person and option 4 where applicable.

CONTRACT_DESC: The Generations Educational Trust wishes to enter into a single-supplier framework agreement with a contractor to deliver the design and off-site construction of energy efficient school blocks.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Minor Works, Lot 1A Framework Agreement
CONTRACT_DESC: This award by North Eastern Universities Purchasing Consortium (‘NEUPC’) is for the establishment of a framework agreement for the procurement of minor building works, comprising of small building installations, refurbishments, repairs, maintenance and improvements on university premises. The framework agreement has been tendered on behalf of select members of NEUPC only (the ‘Participating Consortia’). Those ‘Members’ are: Durham University, Newcastle University, Northumbria University, Teesside University

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Multi-storey Modular Ward Buildings
CONTRACT_DESC: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (‘the Authority’) issued an Invitation to Tender (‘ITT’) in connection with a competitive procurement for the provision of multi-storey modular ward buildings. The purpose of the procurement exercise was to undertake a competition with bidders who have the capability and capacity to meet timescales and cost envelope for the authority. There is an agreed clinical layout which required high level pricing and programme for a Modular Ward Block of between 1-4 storeys.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trusts
CONTRACT_TITLE: The provision of Haematology Full Blood Count (FBC) at Royal Marsden Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_DESC: The Royal Marsden Hospital NHS FT needed to refresh the haematology and blood transfusion equipment at both the Sutton and Chelsea sites and to build greater capacity and resilience into the system. A significant benefit will be to help to move the Blood Sciences project forward leading to an integrated clinical biochemistry and haematology department in which scientific staff can work effectively across traditional disciplines.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Decontamination Consumables and Maintenance
CONTRACT_DESC: The Common Services Agency (more commonly known as National Services Scotland) (‘the Authority’) acting through its division National Procurement, is undertaking this procurement of decontamination equipment maintenance, testing and re-validation and consumables including: chemicals, filters and test materials (‘Products/Services’) on behalf of all entities constituted pursuant to the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978, (i.e. all NHS Scotland Health Boards, Special Health Boards and the Authority or other NHS Organisation established pursuant to the NHS (Scotland) Act 1978), any integrated Joint Boards established pursuant to the new Public Bodies (Joint Working) Scotland Act 2014, together with independent contractors to NHS Scotland such as dentists, general medical practitioners, pharmacists, opticians, etc. and all other bodies governed by Public Law in Scotland.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Occupational Health Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Translink wishes to appoint a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled medical service provider to deliver high quality, timely and cost effective occupational health services for the Translink Group of Companies (comprising Ulsterbus, Citybus Limited (operating as Metro) and NI Railways).

CONTRACT_TITLE: Arc — General Building Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Arc has established a framework agreement for the supply of building works and services. Applications were invited from experienced providers of construction (building) works and services who can provide high quality works and services using a customer focused approach particularly in the public sector. It is anticipated that the works and services will be provided by the providers themselves and/or through their supply chain. Consortia bids were accepted, in the case of group companies only one bid will be accepted from either the group company or one of subsidiaries, but not both. The specific works and services that may be procured under the framework cannot be clearly defined at this stage, however the nature and types of works that may be required may include those services identified by CPV code on or in connection with any land or property and related asset owned, rented, leased or developed by the public sector body eligible to use the framework.

Consortia bids were accepted, in the case of group companies only one bid will be accepted from either the group company or one of subsidiaries, but not both. The specific works and services that may be procured under the framework cannot be clearly defined at this stage, however the nature and types of works that may be required may include those services identified by CPV code on or in connection with any land or property and related asset owned, rented, leased or developed by the public sector body eligible to use the framework.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service
CONTRACT_TITLE: Corporate Finance Services 2
CONTRACT_DESC: Crown Commercial Service (CCS), the authority, has replaced the existing corporate finance services framework (RM3719). The framework is a Pan Government Collaborative Agreement for the provision of corporate finance services to be utilised by central government departments and all other UK public sector bodies, including local authorities, health, police, fire and rescue, education, devolved administrations and charities. The proposed agreement will be the recommended corporate finance solution for the UK public sector, look to deliver value for money to the taxpayer when delivering corporate finance requirements for transactional or advisory services. The framework consists of seven lots, representing the various roles that buyers may choose to appoint one or more suppliers to fulfil their requirements, at call-off stage under the CFS framework. Each lot sets out the scope of work that a supplier may be required to undertake as detailed in Framework Schedule 1 specification.

The new contract will meet both current and future challenges in a very competitive market and bring new technologies and digital solutions to source, manage and develop Services. Active market engagement by the contract provider will be a critical element in order to achieve the necessary insight and understanding of the current marketplace, trends and workplace issues.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Design, Installation and Provision of Audio-Visual Hardware (AV Refresh 2020-2022)
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Plymouth (hereafter referred to as the University) intends to procure AV hardware supply, fitting, installation services, and AV consultancy services to maintain and enhance its teaching and learning spaces and where appropriate to realise opportunities to innovate e.g. to study and learn effectively in technology enriched environments both formally and informally. The University wishes to refresh its Audio Video Estate on a rolling refresh basis where 70-100 rooms would typically be in scope each year to be refreshed.

CONTRACT_TITLE: National Energy Performance Contract Framework (RE:FIT)
CONTRACT_DESC: Greater London Authority (GLA) and Local Partnerships are procuring a framework agreement to succeed the current ‘RE:FIT’ framework. The framework will allow public bodies and registered social landlords to contract with providers to make carbon savings and/or costs savings through implementing energy efficiency and/or energy generation measures to their buildings or estates. Service providers will identify and implement energy efficiency and/or generation measures enabling organisations to cut running costs, reduce energy consumption and lower carbon emissions. As part of the terms of the framework agreement, the service provider will guarantee a set level of savings and/or performance over a period of the arrangement.

Service providers will identify and implement energy efficiency and/or generation measures enabling organisations to cut running costs, reduce energy consumption and lower carbon emissions. As part of the terms of the framework agreement, the service provider will guarantee a set level of savings and/or performance over a period of the arrangement.

CONTRACT_DESC: This procurement exercise is to establish a ‘National Flexible Framework’ in accordance with Regulations 74-76 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015 (further referred to as 'the Flexible Framework') for the purchase of care at home and supported living services, collectively referred to as care and support services.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Security Services Tender 2019
CONTRACT_DESC: Mutual Energy's Security Services Tender 2019. Interconnector Services Ltd (ISL) is the contracting entity within mutual energy. The contract will be for an initial term of 4 years with an option to extend by a further 4 years (at ISL's discretion). Mutual and ISL have determined that the services fall within Schedule 2 to the UCR which means that they are not subject to the full extent of the UCR, but are instead governed by the ‘Light Touch Regime’ contained within Part 3, Chapter 1 of the UCR (Regulations 90 to 93). In terms of following a procurement process we are using a similar process to the negotiated procedure with prior call for competition for good practise measures not because we are obliged to. All queries regarding this tender should be submitted via the correspondence facility through In-Tend and should be submitted before Monday 2nd December at noon. The deadline for PQQ responses is Monday 9 December 2019 at noon.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Jones Bros Ruthin (Civil Engineering) Co. Ltd
CONTRACT_BUYER: LGSS Procurement on behalf of Cambridgeshire County Council
CONTRACT_TITLE: Cambridgeshire County Council A605 Kings Dyke Level Crossing Closure
CONTRACT_DESC: The authority wishes to appoint a provider for design and construction to bypass the level crossing at King’s Dyke, Whittlesey. The works will include 1 km of new road on structural embankments, a new bridge over the railway and accommodating works. The scheme was previously awarded as a two-stage design and build contract, for which a detailed design was completed. Cost estimates increased over time and so the authority is now seeking improved outcomes from the market. The provider will be required to take responsibility for the existing detailed design, but may seek approval from the authority as to where it may be improved. The authority therefore welcomes value engineering exercises from the provider but notes that existing planning consent, site and technical constraints must be all upheld in any proposals which may come forward. Non-material amendments may be considered.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Managed Cleaning and Soft Facilities Maintenance Services to SRUC
CONTRACT_DESC: Scotland’s Rural College (SRUC) delivers comprehensive skills, education and business support for Scotland’s land-based industries, founded on world class and sector-leading research, education and consultancy. SRUC has been formed by the merger of Barony, Elmwood and Oatridge Colleges and the Scottish Agricultural College. SRUC currently has six campuses at Aberdeen, Ayr, Broxburn, Cupar, Dumfries and Edinburgh. SRUC also operates eight farms in addition to 27 consultancy offices and eight veterinary disease surveillance centres.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Shared Lives Services across Conwy and Denbighshire

CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS Shared Business Services Ltd (NHS SBS)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Outsourced Clinical Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Outsourcing of clinical services will offer public sector organisations the ability to purchase additional capacity within an alternative providers own premises, using the providers equipment, systems and staff to help supplement the delivery of patient care. This service will augment capacity and provide quality, value for money outsourced clinical services to achieve reduced waiting lists, excellent standards of care and the safe and timely delivery of services ensuring patients can be seen within suitable and compliant timeframes. Outsourced clinical services are to provide either a full pathway of care, or elements of care as required by the authorised organisation, at the bidder managed facilities, shared facilities or in the community etc., using the bidders own equipment and staff.

Outsourced clinical services are to provide either a full pathway of care, or elements of care as required by the authorised organisation, at the bidder managed facilities, shared facilities or in the community etc., using the bidders own equipment and staff.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Electronic and Security Services Ltd (ESS Ltd)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Security Services Tender 2019
CONTRACT_DESC: Mutual Energy's Security Services Tender 2019. Interconnector Services Ltd (ISL) is the contracting entity within Mutual Energy. The contract will be for an initial term of 4 years with an option to extend by a further 4 years (at ISL's discretion). Mutual and ISL have determined that the services fall within Schedule 2 to the UCR which means that they are not subject to the full extent of the UCR, but are instead governed by the ‘Light Touch Regime’ contained within Part 3, Chapter 1 of the UCR (Regulations 90 to 93). In terms of following a procurement process we are using a similar process to the negotiated procedure with prior call for competition for good practise measures not because we are obliged to. All queries regarding this tender should be submitted via the correspondence facility through InTend and should be submitted before Monday 2

CONTRACT_TITLE: ESF Community Grants
CONTRACT_DESC: The ESFA is looking to procure a number of organisations to undertake the role of Grant Coordinating Bodies (GCB) to deliver a Community Grants Programmes. The Community Grants Programme provides for small grants of up to GBP 20 000 to small organisations in the voluntary and community sector to provide support to unemployed and inactive individuals to engage them and move them towards employment through packages of training and support. The GCB will be required to market and promote the grants programme, manage calls for proposals from third sector organisations, assess applications, make grant awards and monitor and manage the grants that have been awarded.

Solihull MBC is seeking proposals which will cover the following collection options:

CONTRACT_TITLE: Delivery of Childcare
CONTRACT_DESC: Caerphilly CBC (Council) has established an arrangement to deliver childcare places, within the non-maintained sector. For the purpose of this arrangement, the term ‘childcare provision’ will be used for the non-maintained sector including playgroups, cylchoedd meithrin, day nurseries, childminders, out of school provision in both Welsh medium and English medium, including wrap around, before and after school and Holiday provision. In line with the original terms and conditions of the arrangement the Council has re-opened the arrangement and awarded an additional two (2) providers to the arrangement over the two lots:

CONTRACT_TITLE: Connectivity
CONTRACT_DESC: The contract relates to the provision of 4G wireless routers (including 4G data) in order to meet Department for Education's requirement for vulnerable and disadvantaged children in England to have access to the internet as part of an initiative to make remote education and social care services accessible for children and young people during the coronavirus outbreak. 4G wireless routers will be ordered for children who are preparing for exams (year 10), who are care leavers, and secondary school children who receive support from a social worker.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Westminster Primary Schools (cluster 9) — Tender for Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The successful supplier will be required to provide catering services to nine primary/nursery schools based in the London borough of Westminster (see section I): contracting authority).

CONTRACT_TITLE: George Stephenson High School — Tender for Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The successful supplier will be required to provide catering services for George Stephenson High School, Killingworth, NE12 6SA.

CONTRACT_TITLE: The Two Counties Trust — Tender for Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The successful supplier will be required to provide catering services for The Two Counties Trust at the following schools:

CONTRACT_TITLE: NHS Sheffield CCG and Sheffield City Council: Integrated Community Equipment Loan Service (ICELS).
CONTRACT_DESC: The Integrated Community Equipment Loan Service (ICELS) is the mechanism by which community equipment and non-catalogue equipment (Special Equipment) is ordered, loaned, procured, stored, supplied, distributed, collected, decontaminated, recycled and serviced across Sheffield.

SUPPLIER_NAME: ISS Mediclean Ltd trading as ISS Facility Services Education
CONTRACT_TITLE: Lambeth Schools Consortium — Tender for Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Due to government changes to the Schools Funding Reforms in 2013 the Lambeth Schools Consortium (LSC) was formed to centrally supply the school meals service to participating Primary schools in Lambeth. Today, LSC represents 35 Primary schools and 4 nurseries and through its management committee is responsible for ensuring ‘best value’ is maintained for all participating schools. As a consequence, the management committee with agreement from its participating schools now wishes to conduct a tender process for the supply of school meals and catering related services.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Design Services in Highways England Area 4
CONTRACT_DESC: Highways England requires a suitable consultant, that can assist in the preparation of technical designs and undertake supporting work for a number of capital projects from initial scheme feasibility through to the as-built phase.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Weston College Group — Tender for Planned Preventative and Reactive Maintenance Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The successful supplier will be required to provide planned preventative and reactive maintenance services (mechanical, electrical and building fabric) for Weston College Group.

CONTRACT_TITLE: East West Rail Customer Experience Development Procurement
CONTRACT_DESC: In order fulfil the East West Railway Company's (EWR Co) strategic aim of setting a new benchmark for customer experience, EWR Co. has appointed a third-party supplier to assist in the development of a customer strategy and proposition from construction through to end state operation.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Shirebrook Academy and Stubbin Wood School — Tender for Catering Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The successful tenderer will be required to provide catering services at Shirebrook Academy and Stubbin Wood School.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Common Services Agency (more commonly known as NHS National Services Scotland) (‘NSS’)
CONTRACT_TITLE: Storage and Distribution of Seasonal Influenza Vaccine

CONTRACT_TITLE: HMPO Scanning, Validation and Storage
CONTRACT_DESC: Contract for the provision of back-office services for Her Majesty’s Passport Office (HMPO) to support the processing of passport applications. Required services include secure handling and digitisation of documentation, cashiering and payment processing, checking and validation of documentation, physical storage and retrieval of documentation and the return of documentation to the applicant. This service will support the transformation strategy of HMPO to become a modern digital business, reducing and removing reliance on the current paper workflow while maintaining the business continuity of existing services. Services must be delivered from two secure document handling units located at supplier’s facilities. Further information is available via the Crown Commercial Service's eSourcing Suite.

CONTRACT_TITLE: VIVID — Tree Surveys and Works
CONTRACT_DESC: A contract to survey all of our communal trees, across four key areas of operation: Aldershot, Basingstoke, Eastleigh and Portsmouth. Each one broken down into smaller survey areas, generally by estate or ward. It includes local authority planning (LPA) checks for tree preservation orders (TPO’s) and conservations areas (CA’s) and completion of planning applications and notifications, to gain consent for works. A fundamental part of this contract, will be competitively tendering and procuring the immediate and high risk tree surgery works, arising from the survey, including: managing and coordinating the approved contractors, to complete the work to a programme. We use ESRI GIS to digitally map and capture existing and new trees and their attributes, which means being digitally enabled, with software that will interface seamlessly.

This is offered on a basis of direct referral to patients registered with GPs contracted with these CCGs. Commissioners wished to procure an IAPT service for the Staffordshire and Stoke-on-Trent STP footprint via a competitive tender for a single lead (or prime) provider. The successful bidder should be expected to work with the community and voluntary sector to deliver the Service, particularly in relation to the non-IAPT element of the service. The overall aim of the services to provide timely and responsive psychological service to the people of Stoke-on-Trent and Staffordshire who are experiencing any mental health problem that can be treated effectively in primary care.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Walnut Bridge Construction to the Council's Design — second Iteration
CONTRACT_DESC: Guildford Borough Council, working closely with Surrey County Council and with funding from the M3 Local Enterprise Partnership wishes to replace Walnut Bridge in the centre of Guildford. The existing bridge is narrow and has a western entrance that is ‘hidden’ within an existing building, so that only those with local knowledge know of the bridge’s presence. A new bridge structure will also act as a catalyst for the regeneration of the Bedford Wharf site. This pedestrian and cycle bridge forms a vital link between the Railway Station and the Town Centre. The bridge forms a key component of the Guildford Town Centre Transport Package, with the remaining funding workstream from the M3 LEP secured in March 2016. The Council invites applications from suitably qualified operators and supply chains to build the Council's design for the bridge.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Hawick Flood Protection Scheme — Main Works
CONTRACT_DESC: Scottish Borders Council (the Council) intends to take forward a series of flood protection measures in Hawick town centre which will protect over 900 business and residential properties against the effects of the 1 in 75-year flood event in the River Teviot. The works will comprise around 6 km of flood defences walls and embankments, new culverts, surface water pumping stations, Hawick waste water treatment works pumping station, replacement of 3 footbridges and the provision of new landscaping and reinstatement of the riparian corridor. Further details of the proposals, including a list of organisations who have registered an interest in becoming part of the multi layered supply chain that will deliver this project can be found at www.hawickfloodscheme.com.

The number of properties in scope is likely to increase following review of the full estate. Services to include; cleaning, janitorial services, window cleaning, specialised conservation clean and a range of reactive and planned ad-hoc services.

CONTRACT_TITLE: ITT265 Student Recruitment Media Buying Strategy Tender
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Northampton (UON) tendered for a media planning and buying agency. The UON was looking to promote brand awareness of its Undergraduate offering mainly within the UK and Europe but may include increasing awareness of UON to an international market, targeting specific territories such as South East Asia, Sub Sahara Africa and the Middle East. The agency is responsible for the strategic planning of all campaigns and making recommendations on the various media channels that are suitable for the target audience of 16 plus. Must be able to provide competitor reporting and provide recommendations on this information to inform current and future campaign developments and planning. Must have proven experience of working with multiple channels and multiple campaigns at the same time, this will include PPC, social, display (programmatic), broadcast (to include TV), OOH along with proven SEO experience.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Covid-19 Hotel Accommodation Purchase — Increase Bed Capacity
CONTRACT_DESC: Facing unprecedented times the CCG commissioned the increase of bed capacity in the community as an emergency response to Covid-19 to accommodate health and social care clients and patients. The hotel beds in a community care setting would support both discharge from acute hospitals and step up from primary care/community to avoid acute hospital admission if appropriate. Both pathways aimed to support primary care/community providers and create available bed capacity in acute hospitals to enable them to manage the anticipated surge in demand and activity anticipated from Covid-19. Under the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, the contracting authority considers Covid-19 to be a state of urgency that has been brought about by circumstances which a diligent contracting authority could not have foreseen. A response to the pandemic is therefore required in order to safeguard public health risks and risk to life by securing safe and continued service provision.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Gazprom Marketing and Trading Retail Ltd
CONTRACT_TITLE: Supply of Natural Gas
CONTRACT_DESC: We require a flexible risk managed natural gas contract on a rolling basis for 3 years, for the period 1 October 2020 to 30 September 2023. Operating as an aggregated portfolio of natural gas consumption for dailymetered (DM), metered and non-daily metered meters (NDM) forming part of a combined portfolio. We will operate a rolling 3-year purchasing strategy for multiple customers, where gas will be purchased and sold on the traded wholesale energy market via OFGEM licenced suppliers. The portfolio may be split into purchasing in advance of year and purchasing within year. Natural gas is to be priced to the customers on a fixed cost basis for a fixed term period which will have been purchased in advance of delivery and may be greater than one year and as short as one month. The supplier will execute trades via a shared set strategy and customers will be aligned to a common contract start date.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Rochdale Borough Children, Young People and Families’ Substance Misuse Treatment Service UID 4781
CONTRACT_DESC: We are looking for a dynamic organisation(s) with an extensive knowledge of the vulnerabilities and complexities of children and families within the field of substance misuse. The service is expected to utilise strengthening emotional and social resilience of our young people as the enabler to address substance misuse.The service will be expected to consider the family unit in its widest sense to work holistically with all relevant parties and other agencies to coordinate packages of care that best meet those needs but that also recognise strengths and assets. The core aim of this service is to deliver a range of interventions to educate and raise awareness of substance misuse (Tier 1), intervene early to divert people away from misusing substances (Tier2) and where misuse of substances is more deeply entrenched, to provide a range of specialist, evidence based treatment interventions (Tier 3) to enable individuals and their families to recover and sustain a life free from dependency.

SUPPLIER_NAME: The Chancellor Masters and Scholars of The University of Oxford
CONTRACT_TITLE: Procurement of an Assay to Measure Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Antibodies in Human Blood Samples for the UK Biobank study of seroprevalence of Covid-19
CONTRACT_DESC: UK Biobank is conducting a study of seroprevalence of Covid-19 in the population of up to 20 000 of its participants and their adult children and grandchildren (the ‘Study’). The study (which is funded by the Department of Health and Social Care) aims to collect blood samples from study participants each month for an initial period of 6 months and measure these samples to assess the extent of previous infection with the SARS‐CoV‐2 coronavirus (by measuring blood antibodies) in different locations and age groups across the UK. In order to enable the study, UK Biobank needed a supplier to provide an assay which could be used to measure blood antibodies. There was an urgent need to identify a supplier of an assay to enable UK Biobank to design the study – in particular the method of blood collection – to enable the study to start without delay. The study needed to start as soon as possible to enable UK Biobank to report the assay results to DHSC to assist the DHSC in its monitoring of Covid-19 in the population as part of its urgent public health response to the Covid-19 pandemic. Whilst it is UK Biobank that has entered into the contract directly with the assay supplier, the DHSC will be remunerating the supplier direct (rather than payment being made through UK Biobank)

The increasing scale of the data requires a new approach to data storage and access that allows researchers to bring their analyses to the data through implementation of a managed informatics platform for data access and analysis.

CONTRACT_DESC: YPO are looking for providers to be appointed onto a framework agreement for the provision of YPO are looking for providers to be appointed onto a framework agreement for the supply of tyres for motor vehicles, plant and related services for use in the education market and local authority sectors. CONTRACT_TITLE: Glenwood Primary School, Belfast — Appointment of Integrated Consultant Team — Ref MA14-0000A423
CONTRACT_DESC: Appointment of a project manager led integrated consultant team for the delivery of the new Glenwood Primary School, Belfast. The integrated consultant team to provide full professional services for RIBA Plan of Work 2013 Stages 0-7 to include project management, provision of architectural, quantity surveying, structural, services engineering, civil and structural services for delivery of the proposed major works project.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Wirral Community Health and Care NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: 19 093 Healthy Child Programme (0-19 Service)
CONTRACT_DESC: Cheshire East Council are recommissioning the Healthy Child Programme which aims to give children and young people achieve the best start in life and beyond; achieving public health outcomes. The vision for the service is to create an accessible, inclusive offer for children and young people aged 0-19 (up to 24 with SEND) and their families. The service will provide universal and targeted support in local communities, working in a truly integrated way to create a holistic, safe, well informed offer which can provide the right help at the right time. There are four core elements to the service: integrated health visiting (0-5), integrated health (5+), targeted intensive support (Family Nurse Partnership) and breastfeeding support. A significant change is the inclusion of a Central Contact Hub which will act as a single point of access for parents, young people and professionals. A single provider is being sought to deliver the entire requirements of lots 1 and 2.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Learning Campus in Neilston: Project Manager with Multi-Disciplinary Design Team
CONTRACT_DESC: East Renfrewshire Council are looking to appoint a suitably experienced project manager to appoint and lead a multi-functional design team to provide consultancy service for the Neilston village regeneration education campus project (Phase 1).

CONTRACT_BUYER: Dover Federation for the Arts Multi Academy Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: BC-10625 Dover Federation for the Arts Multi Academy Trust Catering
CONTRACT_DESC: The Dover Federation for the Arts Multi Academy Trust is a Dover, Kent based Trust comprising four schools, three primary schools and one secondary school. The proposed contract will be for the outsourced provision of catering services to the client. It is the client’s expectation that the successful bidder shall be responsible for the operation of the catering function including employment and management of staff, supply of foodstuffs, consumables and light equipment and preparing and serving appropriate meals. The client will retain responsibility for payment of utilities and the operation and maintenance of core catering equipment and facilities.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Museum of London West Smithfield Project — Main Works Contract Administrator
CONTRACT_DESC: The appointment of a contract administrator for construction contract(s) (excluding Early Works Contract A) relating to the Museum of London's move to West Smithfield on an as required basis.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Delivery of the Health Professionals Wales Service
CONTRACT_DESC: The Health for Health Professionals Service (HHP) Wales provides all doctors in Primary and Secondary Care with access to British Association for Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapy (BABCP) in their area. Doctors can self refer and are assessed by a doctor adviser, qualified in physicians health, before being referred for face to face counselling. Health for Health Professionals Wales provides all doctors in Primary and Secondary Care with access to British Association for Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapy (BABCP) in their area. Doctors can self-refer and are assessed by a doctor adviser, qualified in physicians’ health, before being referred for face to face counselling.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Intergrated Waste Management and Site Decommissioning and Remediation
CONTRACT_DESC: This framework contract is intended to support the full scope of the integrated waste management and site decommissioning and remediation strategies as outlined in the NDA strategy. The scope of work for the two strategic themes is combined into one framework contract as there are many cross cutting topics relevant to both areas e.g. characterisation and remote technologies.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Salford Crescent and University District Development
CONTRACT_DESC: Salford City Council and Salford University (the Partners) are looking to appoint a private sector partner (PSP) to develop/construct a range of schemes within the 100-hectare Salford Crescent and University District Masterplan area (the Project) over the next 10 years, with an option to extend the contract for a further 5 years (i.e. 15 years in total). The project also requires the PSP to provide a range of ancillary professional services including the delivery of the masterplan.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Passenger Lifts and Communal Platforms — Service and Maintenance
CONTRACT_DESC: This procurement is sourcing suitable contractor for service and maintenance for all Clarion passenger lifts and communal platforms nationwide. This will consist of a planned programme of inspections and responsive repairs for passenger lifts. In total Clarion has 692 passenger lifts and 22 communal platforms. The contract is split into two lots by geographic areas. The aim is to appoint a maximum of two suppliers, each specialising in a particular geographical lot, but also with the possible scope to provide standby coverage in other areas if required.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Supported Accommodation and Floating Support for Individuals who are Homeless or at Risk of Becoming Homeless
CONTRACT_DESC: The aim of the following services is to give service users who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless, access to supported accommodation or support in order to stabilise their lives and gain independent living skills. In addition, the service will provide stable, quality accommodation which enables tenants to sustain their own tenancy, access appropriate services, receive support and move on into permanent housing.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Health Data Research Innovation Gateway Technology Partnership
CONTRACT_DESC: Health Data Research UK is seeking a technology partner to design, deliver and operate the Health Data Research Innovation Gateway — a web application to enable researchers and innovators to search for, request access to and analyse UK health research data held by data custodians in Trusted Research Environments. This project will be delivered as an agile, design-led project delivered collaborative with Health Data Research UK, the Health Data Research Alliance and a wide range of external stakeholders. This work offers a unique opportunity to work in partnership to deliver a game changing portal for health research and innovation.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of an Unpaid Carers and Young Carers Support Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Providing support to carers is a legislative requirement for the Council from the Carers (Scotland) Act 2016. The act requires that local authorities take a number of steps to support carers and make caring more sustainable for those who have to do so.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Hard Facilities Management of Planned and Reactive Internal and External Works
CONTRACT_DESC: EMAS operates out of a variety of freehold and leasehold buildings across 6 counties: Nottinghamshire, Lincolnshire, Derbyshire, Northamptonshire, Leicestershire and Rutland. The purpose of this this contract is to ensure these buildings are maintained in a fashion that makes them operationally safe, secure and statutorily complaint. It will be necessary to ensure that assurances in line with HNB00-08 are observed, reportable on the current position and inform us as to how future operational and financial planning decisions can be made in line with national and local policies.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Whites Close Enhanced Sheltered Housing Scheme
CONTRACT_DESC: Whites Close is a Cornwall Council owned, ex Sheltered Housing Scheme in St Agnes, near Truro, TR5 0TU. Enhanced Sheltered Housing is a specialist type of housing provision designed to offer a safe, private and secure environment. People are able to retain the independence of having their own home whilst enjoying the benefits of having support staff on hand to provide care and support when required throughout the day.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Care and Support for Adults and Young People Preparing for Adulthood Flexible Purchasing System
CONTRACT_DESC: To create a single, flexible, procurement framework which operates as a common, shared ‘marketplace’. There will be a single ‘entry point’ for the six councils and CCG partners to commission services and a single route for providers to register to supply services across the Liverpool City Region (LCR). There will be a common set of contract terms and high level service specifications in operation across the LCR which will include a shared outcome and quality monitoring framework.

CONTRACT_DESC: To create a single, flexible, procurement framework which operates as a common, shared ‘marketplace’. There will be a single ‘entry point’ for the six councils and CCG partners to commission services and a single route for providers to register to supply services across the Liverpool City Region (LCR). There will be a common set of contract terms and high level service specifications in operation across the LCR which will include a shared outcome and quality monitoring framework.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Buckinghamshire Rural Business Broadband Project
CONTRACT_DESC: To provide broadband infrastructure to rural businesses in Buckinghamshire that currently have no next generation access (NGA) infrastructure provided with a download speed greater than 30 mbps utilising the National Broadband Scheme (NBS) 2016.

CONTRACT_TITLE: BC-10620 Birkdale High School Catering
CONTRACT_DESC: Birkdale High School is a Secondary School for boys based in Southport, with 785 pupils ages 11 to 16 on roll from September 2019. The proposed contract will be for the outsourced provision of catering services to the client. It is the client’s expectation that the successful bidder shall be responsible for the operation of the catering function including employment and management of staff, supply of foodstuffs, consumables and light equipment and preparing and serving appropriate meals. The client will retain responsibility for payment of utilities and the operation and maintenance of core catering equipment and facilities. The contract period will be for 3 years initially with the option to extend for two further 1-year periods.

CONTRACT_BUYER: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: Pharmacy Partners Dynamic Purchasing System: Tender Round 3
CONTRACT_DESC: Umbrella is the provider of sexual health services in Birmingham and Solihull. Umbrella is a partnership, led by University Hospitals Birmingham (the Authority), consisting of a number of community-based organisations, charities and health service providers. In 2016, the authority established a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for community based sexual health services in pharmacies. The call-off contracts that are the subject of this contract award notice were awarded as a result of tender round 3 under the DPS.

CONTRACT_TITLE: JAN1009-AP Laundry Services — APUC
CONTRACT_DESC: The authority was seeking contractor(s) to provide laundry services and associated services for institutions across Scotland. The provision of laundry services was split into two separate service models: one model covered all laundry services, including the hire of garments and linen. The other service model solely covers the collection, wash and return of institution owned linen and garments.

CONTRACT_BUYER: NHS North Hampshire Clinical Commissioning Group
CONTRACT_TITLE: F8852 Complex Continuing Healthcare Domiciliary Service for Children
CONTRACT_DESC: Emphasis will be placed on the promotion of independence and the achievement of positive outcomes for the individual. Complex Care will include the provision of a care team and may also include the ordering, maintenance and disposal of specialist equipment, ancillary supplies, prescription management, any or all of which may be required by the individual and will be set out in their care plan. The majority of Individuals will have severe complex health needs or a significant disability or/and an additional mental health need that impacts upon their daily lives. However, the service may also be required to support families/carers experiencing a range of difficulties. The services will primarily be available to individuals in their own living location, however, there will be occasions where the care package will be provided in an alternative environment.

CONTRACT_TITLE: The Snowdon Project
CONTRACT_DESC: Main contractor's construction works to replace the cable and mesh of the existing 1960's Snowdon Aviary whilst maintaining the original tetrahedral frame. All existing planting will be replaced, the main contractor will manage the planting of new large trees within their programme. A new, geodesic shaped, gridshell structure is to be built adjacent to the aviary. It will be used as a monkey house for Colobus monkeys and will be connected to the Snowdon Aviary by high level tunnels called ‘colobridges’. The main contractor will also be responsible for packages of contractors design and all hardscaping.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Supported Employment for Adults Experiencing Mental Ill Health
CONTRACT_DESC: This is for the provision of supported employment services to adults in Essex experiencing mental ill health. The proposed approach, based on broad stakeholder engagement, including engagement with individuals with lived experience, is to procure a lead provider(s) to deliver supported mental health employment services across Essex via two lots. The supported employment services are a non-statutory service and are aimed at improving the wellbeing of people mental health illness. We believe that employment is a key enabler to supporting recovering and independence and can help people become less reliant on statutory health and social care services.
