SUPPLIER_NAME: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: NHS111/Clinical Assessment Service for Kent, Medway and Sussex CCGs
CONTRACT_DESC: NHS 111 provides a vital service to help people with urgent care needs to get assessment, clinical advice and treatment quickly, taking around 15 million calls a year. The service will be further enhanced by increasing clinical consultation for patients calling 111, so that more patients get the care and advice they need over the phone and only those who genuinely need to attend A&E or use the ambulance service are advised to do this. All other patients will have their issue resolved over the phone if at all possible or if not will be directed to appropriate primary care or community services, with an emphasis on strongly supporting patients in self-care.

CONTRACT_TITLE: APUC Waste Management Services
CONTRACT_DESC: The authority was seeking contractors for waste management services for all HE/FE institutions in Scotland. EFM1027 — AP waste management services is a tailored framework agreement for all institutions in Scotland to provide essential waste management services and solutions for institutions covering waste awareness and segregation programmes, collection, uplift, treatment and disposal of waste, substances and materials which are compliant with current and future legislation. Due to the differing nature of the waste, substance and materials involved, the framework agreement is split into five defined waste stream schedules for general waste and materials through to specialised waste and materials across up to five geographical regions. The framework agreement also includes two lots designed to provide access to innovative solutions for specific waste streams and materials to further promote the waste hierarchy and circular economy.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Open Framework for the Provision of Older Adults Residential and Nursing Care Services
CONTRACT_DESC: From time to time as part of the commissioning process, the Council needs to re-contract providers of residential and nursing care. The Council is therefore launching the ‘Open Framework for the Provision of Older Adults Residential and Nursing Care Services’, a new contract for providers of older adults residential and nursing care services. Via this new contract, the Council is aiming to support the provider market to develop the increasingly complex residential and nursing care services required to meet the changing needs of the Cumbrian population.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Tender for Glazing Supply and Fit to Tenanted Properties 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council had a requirement for the reactive supply and fit of glazing to tenanted houses and a range of other council properties. The contract period will be 1 July 2020 to 30 June 2024. The estimated value excluding VAT for the duration of the contract is GBP 1 000 000.00. This value is based on historical spend data and is intended to be used as a guide only and is not a guarantee of the level of business that will be generated from the contract.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Young Persons Housing Support
CONTRACT_DESC: This procurement is concerned with the purchase of services for a housing support service to individuals aged 16-25 who are experiencing or at risk of homelessness. Stirling Council require the service to be staffed 24 hours a day, 7 days a week (including public holidays). The service is required to provide outreach support to people that are living in homeless temporary accommodation including B&B and at their own tenancy across the local authority. This will include young people who are involved in through care/aftercare services and young people who have been looked after in care

CONTRACT_TITLE: Block Bed Contract at The Bexhill Care Centre
CONTRACT_DESC: The Covid-19 situation has meant that we have needed to respond to consequences immediately because of imminent risk to public health. As part of the response by local NHS Clinical Commissioning Groups and ESCC, there is a requirement to make available up to 3 000 additional nursing beds for use as step down nursing beds for the anticipated additional patients who will require care as a result of either contracting Covid-19, or because the Covid-19 crisis means that the usual provision of nursing beds is no longer available for them. The Bexhill Care Centre has 43 beds.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Surgical Gowns
CONTRACT_DESC: Surgical gowns.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Home Support Framework for Norfolk
CONTRACT_DESC: Norfolk County Council re-opened the LTR framework agreement for the provision of home support services in Norfolk and has awarded to 3 providers. The framework agreement is for both individual packages and multiple packages of care. The Council will work with successful providers to optimise efficiency and reduce unmet need wherever possible. The expectation is that successful providers will work collaboratively to facilitate this.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Operational Excellence Strategic Delivery Partner 2025
CONTRACT_DESC: Highways England is a Government owned company responsible for operation and maintenance of the main motorways and a-roads across England.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Secretary of State for the Home Department, Emergency Services Mobile Communications Programme (ESMCP)
CONTRACT_TITLE: ICCS Software Development for the Emergency Services Network (‘ESN’) — Frequentis
CONTRACT_DESC: The supplier is a provider of integrated command and control system (ICCS) to the UK 3ES. This contract is to enable their services (as deployed to the supplier’s UK 3ES customers) to be upgraded to work with the new Emergency Services Network.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Secretary of State for the Home Department, Emergency Services Mobile Communications Programme (ESMCP)
CONTRACT_TITLE: ICCS Software Development for the Emergency Services Network (‘ESN’) — Systel
CONTRACT_DESC: The supplier is a provider of integrated command and control system (ICCS) to the UK 3ES. This contract is to enable their services (as deployed to the supplier’s UK 3ES customers) to be upgraded to work with the new Emergency Services Network.

CONTRACT_TITLE: The Provision of Strategic Asset Management Services for Cambridgeshire Community Services NHS Trust and Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_DESC: Cambridgeshire Community Services NHS Trust, working in collaboration with Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Foundation Trust have established a framework agreement through the competitive dialogue process and awarded the framework agreement to a single provider for strategic asset management services, which is predominantly Hard FM services with some Soft FM services and other incremental options, for use by the Trusts initially calling off of the framework but also available for other UK public sector bodies, which include NHS bodies and local authorities. As part of this framework, the Trust has included a number of related non-exclusive incremental services, which may be called off at some point during the life of the framework and also to provide similar call-off contract opportunities to other authorities identified on the contract notice in respect of their Hard FM, asset management and incremental services needs as defined from time to time.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DE 1218877-Appointment of an ICT for Fort Hill IC and IPS, Lisburn
CONTRACT_DESC: The appointment of a project manager led integrated consultants team to include: project management, provision of architectural, quantity surveying, structural, civil, building services design and lead designer services for input and development of initial design proposals to RIBA Plan of Work 2013 Stage 3 and to successfully obtain planning approval prior to undertaking the procurement of an Integrated Supply Team (IST) to undertake the detailed design and construction of the new Fort Hill Integrated College and Integrated Primary School. Thereafter providing design advisory, technical review, monitoring of the IST and audit services throughout the construction works. For a complete description of this procurement refer to the pre-qualification questionnaire package. The contract will be awarded to the economic operator which has submitted the Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) using the mean narrow average, price scoring mechanism – refer to draft ITT document 1 of 4.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Services for People with a Learning Disability and/or Autism with Additional Needs
CONTRACT_DESC: Rounds 3, 4 and 5 awarded — people with a learning disability and/or autism and additional needs have the same right to citizenship as non-disabled people. This right to citizenship includes the right to be treated with dignity and respect, the right to have direction, the support and money needed to live a live in their community of choice, living with the people they choose to live with, having meaningful occupation and enjoying love and relationships. Essentially, an ‘Ordinary Life’. We are seeking providers who can offer support depending upon the needs and outcomes required by individuals. Services will either be residential nursing, residential, supported living, or day opportunities, dependent upon the needs of the identified individual or individual group.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TD1513 — The Supply of Services in respect of Bus Station Facilities Management
CONTRACT_DESC: With over 14 million people using Derby bus station every year, the site forms a key asset in the cities public transport network. The bus station is open for business for between 17-19 hours a day, 363 days a year with over 115 buses departing the site during the busiest hour. To ensure people feel confident to use bus services it is essential that the bus station is kept clean and secure. Since the bus station opened in March 2010 a service provider has provided cleaning, security and information office services on site. This contract is now coming to an end and we are therefore seeking to retender the work.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Mental Health Service Provider Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Leeds and York Partnership NHS Foundation Trust (LYPFT), (the ‘Authority’) is issuing this invitation to tender (‘ITT’) in connection with the competitive procurement to establish a framework agreement for mental health service providers for Leeds, and the North of England. Across NHS providers of mental health services, there is recognition of the value that external organisations (for example, third sector, charitable sector) can offer when treating patients and service users with a wide range of mental health needs. This agreement is seeking to establish a framework of providers who are able to offer services across a geographical area (see Schedule A Specification) and a range of specialisms in order to support the services offered by the NHS.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Department of Health and Social Care
CONTRACT_TITLE: Contract for the Supply of Goods Related to Testing for Covid-19
CONTRACT_DESC: These is a requirement to establish supplies for a high-throughput quantitative serology method to identify people (initially NHS staff and patients and other key workers) who have had Covid-19 and have developed antibodies. This testing will help provide a better understanding of the disease and therefore inform the next stages of the Covid-19 strategy such as how to ease lock-down measures. The UK Chief Medical Officers previously agreed that we should be procuring centrally, where possible to avoid internal competition in relation to supplies. This also includes avoiding duplicating validations exercises of the same kit. Therefore, we have reached out to the devolved administrations (DAs) and Crown Dependencies (CD’s) to engage them with the validation and roll-out plans. The existing high throughput platforms have enough capacity to meet patient demand and to provide testing of NHS staff.

CONTRACT_TITLE: NHS Health Check Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Lancashire County Councils aim is that 20 % of the eligible population is offered a health check every year. Aims of the service include providing opportunistic offers for NHS Health Checks across a variety of settings including the workplace, places of worship and communities within Lancashire. This NHS Health Check programme is aimed at people living and working in Lancashire who are between 40 and 74 year olds. Particular attention should be paid to communities who are known to be at increased risk of developing cardiovascular disease, for example deprived communities, South East Asian communities and working men.

CONTRACT_TITLE: 001023 — Educational Seating
CONTRACT_DESC: YPO are looking for providers to be appointed onto a framework agreement for the provision of educational seating incorporating chairs, stools and fabric swivel student chairs to cover multiple environments and classroom setting predominantly (but not limited to) within the educational environments. The framework can also be utilised by the private sector. This framework is designed to allow YPO to meet the needs of all public sector organisations by establishing an agreement for providers to deliver to YPO customers on a direct basis whereby the end customer places the order with YPO and YPO places the order with the provider, but the provider delivers direct to the end customer.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The Minister for the Cabinet Office acting through Crown Commercial Service
CONTRACT_TITLE: Public Services Network (PSN) Core Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Crown Commercial Service (CCS) has established a framework for the provision of public services network (PSN) core services which allows the government to send information electronically and securely. The framework will be used by or on behalf of the whole of the UK public sector and their associated bodies and agencies, the voluntary sector, charities and/or other private organisations acting as managing agents or procuring on behalf of the public sector delivering services of a public nature. The aim for this framework was to replace two core services currently provided by the Government GSI Convergence Framework (GCF) and was to be delivered under two lots (Lot 1: PSN Domain Name System (DNS) services and Lot 2: PSN Email Relay (including hygiene) services). Lot 2 has not been awarded only lot 1 has been awarded.

CONTRACT_TITLE: TD1537b — Dry Mixed Recycling Processing
CONTRACT_DESC: Derby City Council (‘the Council’) requires a contractor to provide processing of dry mixed recycling (DMR) from 1 April 2020 and will end on 8 June 2023. Further, there will be an option to extend the service period. There will be two extensions possible, each of up to one (1) year in duration. The Council is responsible for waste services for c.256 000 residents living in c.107 000 households. The Council provides a service to residents which includes fortnightly collection of DMR, predominantly from 240 l wheel bins. Additionally, the Council also offers commercial waste services in the area, servicing approximately 500 businesses. The DMR will be delivered to the successful bidder, at their nominated delivery point, via bulk haulage vehicles.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Department of Health and Social Care
CONTRACT_TITLE: Contract for the Supply of Goods Related to Testing for Covid-19
CONTRACT_DESC: These is a requirement to establish supplies for a high-throughput quantitative serology method to identify people (initially NHS staff and patients and other key workers) who have had Covid-19 and have developed antibodies. This testing will help provide a better understanding of the disease and therefore inform the next stages of the Covid-19 strategy such as how to ease lock-down measures. The UK Chief Medical Officers previously agreed that we should be procuring centrally, where possible to avoid internal competition in relation to supplies. This also includes avoiding duplicating validations exercises of the same kit. Therefore, we have reached out to the devolved administrations (DAs) and Crown Dependencies (CD’s) to engage them with the validation and roll-out plans. The existing high throughput platforms have enough capacity to meet patient demand and to provide testing of NHS staff.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Smart Street Lighting
CONTRACT_DESC: The smart street lighting project is an invest to save strategy for the Bradford District and will involve the replacement of old street lighting luminaires with LED units and replace life expired columns. The work will include: survey comprising of up to 56 500 (fifty-six thousand five hundred) street light assets, design comprising of up to 53 700 (fifty three thousand seven hundred) assets, luminaire changes to street light assets comprising of up to 32 700 (thirty two thousand seven hundred) with between 3 000 and 7 000 (three thousand and seven thousand) requiring sleeving. Column replacements to street light assets comprising of up to 15 600 (fifteen thousand six hundred). Load (kwh per year) must be reduced by at least 65 %. Please note that the maintenance and repair of existing assets as well as responsibility for converting heritage/specialist lighting to LED will continue to be delivered by the in house operational teams.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Milltimber Replacement School (8073)
CONTRACT_DESC: The project involves the construction of a new single storey 2 stream primary school with early learning provision to accommodate 434 pupils plus 60 nursery pupils. Internally the building will include the usual ancillary accommodation whilst externally hard and soft landscaping plus a 60m x 40m 3G all weather synthetic pitch is to be provided.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Student Peer Mentoring Solution
CONTRACT_DESC: The Open University (OU) have tendered for a student peer mentoring solution to be delivered as a software as a service (Saas)/cloud based solution, including support and maintenance. The solution is to facilitate online 1:1 vertical peer mentoring for the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (FASS) students. The platform should allow (initial pilot up to 5 000) students to communicate on a one to one basis at a distance — experienced students will act as mentors for newer students (mentees). OU students have expressed a desire for pastoral support. Student peer mentoring has been identified as one mechanism to deliver that support. The solution may be rolled out further across the OU subject to a successful pilot and further funding becoming available.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Sanmar Denizcilik Mak. ve Tic. A.S.
CONTRACT_TITLE: Supply of Two New Towage Boats (Design and Build)
CONTRACT_DESC: The Council, as Statutory Harbour Authority has a requirement for the supply of one tug boat and/or design and build of up to two new tug boats which meet the Council’s specification, which are required to provide a safe and reliable towage service in the Scapa Flow (including Flotta Oil Terminal) and Kirkwall harbour areas and elsewhere.The existing fleet of three (3) tug boats (built 1989 and 1992) requires to be replaced as part of a planned programme in order to provide towage to the Flotta Oil Terminal, Scapa Flow and Kirkwall and to meet increasing demands and specification requirements within and beyond Orkney for towage. With a modern design vessel it is expected that greater operational safety margins, flexibility and efficiencies will be achieved.

CONTRACT_TITLE: SC19017 VPRS Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: The opportunity concerns the delivery of the official Government refugee resettlement schemes in Kent. Currently these are the Syrian Vulnerable Persons Relocation Scheme (VPRS) and the Vulnerable Children’s Resettlement Scheme (VCRS) but from Spring 2020 these (and the Government Gateway programme) are due to merge into the new UK Resettlement scheme. The service being commissioned is the resettlement and integration support for refugees relocating to Kent under these and any similar future scheme yet to be announced, both for existing families and new families from April 2020. The service will be expected to provide the above support for initially the first 3-years of each refugee’s stay in the UK, with the potential for an extension of up to a further 2-years, depending on individual need and available funding.

CONTRACT_DESC: Provision of goods and services to support the UK Covid-19 testing strategy. CONTRACT_TITLE: Cleaning Services at Buckinghamshire Council
CONTRACT_DESC: The new Unitary Buckinghamshire Council which came into existence on the 1 April 2020 is seeking a contractor for cleaning services at (what is currently called) Aylesbury New County Offices and Wycombe District Council Offices and 54 other sites across the County. The other sites include (but not limited to) adult learning centers, libraries and community centers. The contract spend for all these locations is estimated at GBP 772 000 per annum. This is only an estimate and the actual spend maybe higher or lower than this figure. Cleaning services are to be provided for office areas, meeting rooms, circulation areas, washroom areas, kitchen and catering areas, external areas including internal and external window cleaning. The contract will commence on the 1 August 2020.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Cloud Management Information System
CONTRACT_DESC: United Learning is an educational charity that manages independent schools and state sector academies in the UK. The Trust will grow its number of academies at about 5 % per annum over the contract term. To support the Trust’s ‘Shift to the Cloud’ strategy, we seek a supplier to provide a cloud Management Information System (MIS) for our state sector primary, secondary and all-through academies. Some of the Trust’s academies have already implemented a cloud MIS, therefore this procurement will provide a cloud MIS to the remaining academies and new academies as they join the Trust. The MIS will be accessed over the internet and hosted in the cloud, with requisite programme management, support and implementation services also provided.

CONTRACT_DESC: NHS Supply Chain: food seeked to award a/or supplier(s) for the supply of fruit and vegetables under the school fruit and vegetable scheme (SUSFVS). The awarded supplier(s) will be responsible for the supply and delivery of the goods to the awarded distributor(s) within the scheme in England. It is anticipated that in the first year of the framework agreement the value will be in the region of GBP 27 000 000. For the full term the anticipated value is between GBP 108 000 000. These values are approximate only and are based on the most recent historical usage information, with a forecasted level of growth and upon the assumption that the school fruit and vegetable scheme will remain unchanged. The values provided are for guidance only and are not a guarantee of business.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Future Automated Aerospace Assembly Demonstrator Phase 2 (FA3D2) Concept
CONTRACT_DESC: The Centre for Aerospace Manufacturing (CAM) at the University of Nottingham (UoN) works with partners from across the UK and European aerospace industry to deliver industrially focused research into aerospace assembly systems. Advanced manufacturing is a key research priority area for Nottingham and the University has invested significantly in this research. The University made a strategic investment in automated assembly infrastructure through the Future Automated Aerospace Assembly Demonstrator (FA3D) project, which was commissioned in 2016. Based on the success of this project, funding has been secured from the UK Government’s Industrial Strategy Challenge Fund (ISCF) through the Aerospace Technology Institute (ATI) for development of the second phase of this demonstrator.

CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Chester has already appointed suitably qualified organisations onto a Dynamic Purchasing System to deliver a range of skills solutions and training options to Cheshire and Warrington employees until 30 November 2022. CONTRACT_TITLE: Non-Destructive Testing and Inspection Engineers
CONTRACT_DESC: Yorkshire Water (YW) manage the collection, treatment and distribution of water in Yorkshire, supplying around 1 240 000 000 litres of drinking water each day. At the same time collecting, treating and disposing of about one billion litres of waste water safely back into the environment. The contract will be part of the asset integrity team’s delivery of process safety works. A range of specialist technical services will be selectively employed across YW’s estate to support applications and processes for raw water, treated water, waste water, sewerage treatment and clean and sewer networks. These services are vital to supporting safety and compliance across YW’s business. This directly links to the business commitments and performance measures contained within Yorkshire Water’s business plan. YW therefore intends to establish a framework for Nitrogen Purging and Digester Maintenance.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) — NHS Southport and Formby CCG and NHS South Sefton CCG
CONTRACT_DESC: The awarded service is to improve access to psychological therapies for the populations of Southport and Formby CCG and South Sefton CCG and provide timely interventions, delivered from accessible community venues that will improve mental health and wellbeing. The provider will be required to deliver interventions at step 2, 3 of the stepped care model in accordance to NICE guidelines, using validated evidence-based assessment monitoring and outcome tools. Also, as part of a local initiative step 4 will be delivered.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: Grounds and Gardens Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Roseberry Park Hospital is an NHS hospital in Middlesbrough specialising in the provision of mental health services, and children’s learning disabilities services. The hospital is made up of a number of self-contained ward units, clustered around closed landscaped courtyards, other non-clinical buildings, a ‘plaza’ and car parks. The Trust requires the provision of a comprehensive grounds and gardens maintenance service for this site in order to maintain an aesthetically pleasing landscape that is complementary to the Trust and the local environment throughout the year.

SUPPLIER_NAME: Vigilant Security (Scotland) Ltd trading as Croma Vigilant
CONTRACT_BUYER: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: Car Parking and Security Service
CONTRACT_DESC: Roseberry Park Hospital is an NHS hospital in Middlesbrough specialising in the provision of mental health services and children’s learning disabilities services. The hospital is made up of a number of self-contained ward units, clustered around closed landscaped courtyards, other non-clinical buildings, a ‘plaza’ and car parks. The Trust requires the provision of a comprehensive car parking and security management service. The security management service will be provided to the external of the facilities and to the adult mental health central support facilities. The car park management service will provide a secure and safe car park environment for patients, staff and visitors to the Hospital.

Members of NWUPC (https://www.nwupc.ac.uk/our-members) and NEUPC (http://www.neupc.ac.uk/who-are-our-members) are also permitted to use the agreement. Gallagher as the appointed insurance broker to LUPC, will provide technical support and guidance throughout the procurement exercise. CONTRACT_TITLE: The Provision of Advocacy and Litigation Services for Highways England Specialist Claims
CONTRACT_DESC: Highways England is looking to let a contract for advocacy and litigation services, this will cover the support and litigation of network claims (Green Claims) where Highways England will be the legal claimant. The work will include taking claims through litigation on our behalf, providing advice and support on the more complex and high value claims, assisting with clearing our backlog of in excess of 2 500 claims and supporting claims where liability may be in question. This may also include supporting new ways of pricing claims other than actuals but ensuring that it remains reasonable. Highways England are looking to appoint one (1) supplier, the contract will be let for a period of 2 years with an option to extend for 12 months.

CONTRACT_TITLE: PROJ10008 — Girls' Education Challenge Phase 2b (GEC2b)
CONTRACT_DESC: The Girls Education Challenge is a Fund Management programme. It is working to provide quality education for up to 1.5 million marginalised and highly marginalised girls. The GEC aims to find better ways of getting girls. into school and ensuring they receive a quality education and learn whilst they are there. GEC is the world’s largest fund dedicated to girls’ education. DFID are now procuring a new fund manager to continue services in order to complete the work to meet the original target numbers of marginalised girls supported by existing projects until the programme’s natural end in June 2025. The programme is currently estimated to be reaching over 1.4 million marginalised girls and 230 000 highly marginalised girls. Ensuring they continue to learn, complete primary school and transition to and through secondary education and then enter further education, training or employment, gaining literacy, numeracy and other skills relevant for life and work.

CONTRACT_TITLE: National Safeguarders Panel Management Service 2020-2024
CONTRACT_DESC: The Scottish Government has a requirement to place a contract with an external service provider for the provision of National Safeguarders Panel Management Service 2020-2024. Safeguarders are appointed by children’s hearings or sheriffs where there is a requirement to safeguard the interests of the child in the proceedings. The Safeguarders provides the hearing and/or court with an independent assessment of what is in the child’s best interest. Safeguarders are a well-established and valued element of the Children’s Hearings System providing independent scrutiny of assessments and plans for children.

CONTRACT_TITLE: BHCC and ESCC Term, Reactive and Planned Maintenance
CONTRACT_DESC: Brighton and Hove City Council (BHCC) and East Sussex County Council (ESCC) are seeking applications from suitably qualified and interested organisations for a range of facilities management services. This will include the procurement of a number of Term Maintenance and Planned Maintenance contract and frameworks split into two distinct workstreams.The services and works are required for the Participating Authorities assets which mainly include Schools and Corporate buildings, but excludes Housing and Highways. A Prior Information Notice (PIN) was issued on 24 June 2019 and the reference is 2019/S 119-290868. The Councils held market engagement events in July and October 2019 as part of its pre-procurement activity. Information regarding these events is published with the Procurement Documents.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Security Services
CONTRACT_DESC: Security services for LB Bexley including key holding and out of hours response. The services are currently provided under a total facilities management contract with one provider which will expire on 31 August 2020. There are currently 6 sites in scope for the main security services, including Bexley Civic Offices, Council Depot and four non-operational sites. There are currently 39 buildings in scope for key holding services. Services to include: static guarding, key holding, out of hours response and a range of ad hoc services, such as events management.

CONTRACT_TITLE: IT and AV Integrator for Dubai Campus
CONTRACT_DESC: Heriot-Watt University will be vacating its current campus in Academic City at the end of 2020 and moving to a new campus and building in Knowledge Park. The building is a new build consisting of 7 floors and covering 218,109 Sq.ft. The new campus will accommodate 3 000 existing students and 300 Heriot-Watt staff, but it is envisaged that this will need to provide adequate provision, facilities and infrastructure to accommodate up to 5 000 students by 2025. Teaching is scheduled to start at the new campus on 13 January 2021.

CONTRACT_TITLE: UK Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) Monitoring Network in the UK
CONTRACT_DESC: The Contract is to deliver and operate the UK Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) Monitoring Network. The network provides United Kingdom wide national ambient air quality monitoring for PAHs. The contract will deliver various work packages involving preparing sample filters, managing the field monitoring, maintaining agency sampling assets, reporting, sample submission and submission of ratified site data results to the UK air website.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Manydown Development
CONTRACT_DESC: Manydown is a government-recognised transformational housing project comprising an area of approximately 843 ha (2 080 acres) west of Basingstoke, which could ultimately see the delivery of 7 800 homes in total in the current local plan period and beyond. The initial phases of the Manydown project have been allocated for at least 3 200 (with potential for this to be increased by 10 % up to 3 520) private and affordable dwellings in the first phase with the potential to develop a further 4 600 dwellings in future phases, subject to satisfactory performance during phase 1, community accommodation together with associated infrastructure and commercial/retail space. Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council and Hampshire County Council (‘the councils’), acting as joint land owners, wish to deliver the project in conjunction with a partner through a joint venture arrangement. The partner, or consortium of partners, will bring expertise, creativity and financial resources to the development.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Empty Homes Security

The client was seeking bids from service providers to participate in a tender exercise for the procurement of service providers to deliver empty homes security services. Livv Housing Group was looking for a single service provider to deliver empty home security services across a number of sites within the North West.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Framework Award — C1546.315 Public Health Practitioner (Degree Apprenticeship) Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: Salisbury NHS Foundation Trust are working in partnership with Health Education England and Public Health England, on behalf of public and third sector employer organisations, in creating a national (England) framework for the provision of Public Health Degree Apprenticeships. This does not represent a commitment to spend and will rely on individual employer uptake. This framework will enable education providers and employers to work collaboratively to create high quality, employer led programmes to meet the needs of today's Public Health workforce.

This will be reactive work as and when required by NRW.

CONTRACT_DESC: The Council has recently approved the investment of GBP 45 000 000 to carry out the replacement of the existing street lighting including around 59 000 luminaires and 17 000 lighting columns. To supplement its own internal resources the Council is seeking to establish a strategic partnership with a contractor/consultant who is able to offer a range of support staff for a number of roles on this project. CONTRACT_TITLE: Catering Services Contract for Colyton Grammar School, East Devon
CONTRACT_DESC: Colyton Grammar School is a co-educational grammar school located in the village of Colyford, nr Colyton in East Devon, that teaches students from years 7 to 13, with approximately 955 students and 100 staff. The contract period will be for 3 years initially with the option to extend for two further one year periods. An outsourced services contractor is being sought to provide the catering services for the main school and sixth form; the current services are provided in-house. Value of the turnover is approx GBP 355 000 per annum.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Procurement for the Construction of Modular (Volumetric) Residential Accommodation including the Manufacture and Delivery of Modules and full Site Construction Services
CONTRACT_DESC: CHIC is procuring three contracts for the manufacture, supply and erection of new modular (volumetric) Homes with options for all site works. For two lots, the works may routinely include all associated construction works on site in a whole scheme 'turnkey' approach, all as described in fuller detail in the invitation to tender. For the third lot the site works will be an option. The CHIC Members have requirements predominantly across central and southern England and in Wales, but not exclusively so. They may in the future have requirements in all other parts of England, Wales and Scotland. CHIC is owned by Registered Providers (Housing Associations, ALMOs and Local Authorities) and has large scale membership (currently 92 members). CHIC has successfully delivered a range of materials and works contracts for its members over the last 10 years and these new contracts will form a part of the CHIC 'Buildsmart' approach to the development of new homes by current and future members.

CONTRACT_TITLE: DUD-Tender for VLR National Innovation Centre
CONTRACT_DESC: Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council (DMBC) is seeking a suitably experienced contractor to tender for the design and construction of a new build National Innovation Centre (NIC), utility building, drainage and external works at recently cleared railway land adjacent to A4037 Tipton Road, Dudley, DY1 4AH. The NIC will be constructed on land owned by DMBC. This project will create the National Innovation Centre (NIC) for Very Light Rail (VLR) research. The NIC and associated external works will spur research, innovation and product design in very light rail, traditional rail and motor vehicle technology.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Student Recruitment and Admissions Enquiry System
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Edinburgh is seeking a supplier to implement an enquiry management solution to support our student recruitment and admissions processes as well as providing an improved service for staff and prospective students. The tool will replace existing ad-hoc student enquiry tracking currently done in outlook and local databases, managed by multiple service areas/teams across the University. The solution will be managed by a specialist enquiry handling service (newly created team) and utilised by key users across multiple service areas. The new tool is expected to enable queue management, provide management information and market intelligence through the use of categorisation, customisable template responses. Duplicates will be removed, forwarding will be reduced and a full conversation history will be available to staff in order to contextualise their responses. The tool will be linked to our SITS solution in order to utilise key information from the application record where appropriate.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Waking Watch to 9 x High Rise Blocks Birmingham (Award Notice)

The need for this service was as a consequence of receiving the test results for panels (fixed below the windows to the nine blocks) which we had sent for testing in accordance with the actions contained within the most recent fire risk assessment. The commission has been provided in full consultation with the West Midlands Fire Service (WMFS), who have confirmed that our approach satisfies their requirements for mitigation of the risks associated with the blocks.

It is the client’s expectation that the successful bidder shall be responsible for the operation of the catering function including employment and management of staff, supply of foodstuffs, consumables and light equipment and preparing and serving appropriate meals. The contract period will be for 3 years initially with the option to extend for 2 further 1 year periods. The service is currently provided by a single outsourced provider. The services are to be provided at the following addresses: Crown Lane Primary School, Granton Primary School, Hitherfield Primary School Immanuel and St Andrew Church of England Primary School, Julian's School St Leonard's Church of England Primary School, Streatham Wells Primary School Sunnyhill Primary School.

CONTRACT_TITLE: IF105 — Integrated Partnerships Framework
CONTRACT_DESC: NI Water wishes to set up a strategic integrated partnerships framework to support delivery of its proposed water and sewerage capital investments. The IF105 Integrated Partnerships Framework will be set up as 3 multi-party lots (as set out further below). Economic operators are entitled to submit tenders for 1, several or for all separate individual lots of the framework. However please note that NI Water will not appoint the same economic operator or group of economic operators to more than one lot. This rule will not though preclude the appointment of an economic operator to one lot and the appointment of the same economic operator as part of a group of economic operators or as a subcontractor to another economic operator or group of economic operators on another lot.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Diffusers
CONTRACT_DESC: Yorkshire Water (YW) manage the collection, treatment and distribution of water in Yorkshire, supplying around 1 240 000 000 litres of drinking water each day. At the same time collecting, treating and disposing of about one billion litres of waste water safely back into the environment. The contract will support service delivery in maintaining key operational activities. A range of specialist technical services will be selectively employed across YW’s estate to support applications and processes for raw water, treated water, waste water, sewerage treatment and clean and sewer networks. These services are vital to supporting safety and compliance across YW’s business. This directly links to the business commitments and performance measures contained within Yorkshire Water’s business plan. YW therefore intends to establish a framework for providing/upgrading diffuser systems.

CONTRACT_TITLE: SCC JS Digital and Business Insights (ERP Solution)
CONTRACT_DESC: SCC is seeking responses to this selection questionnaire from providers who are able to provide a fully integrated ERP system on a software as a service (SaaS) basis and implement and configure the system. The ERP system may be an already fully integrated system or a fully integrated combination of best of breed ERP systems. The system will include modules for Finance, Procurement, HR and payroll, which are currently supplied by a SAP system. The Council requires one lead supplier to take overall delivery responsibility for implementation and to enter into any contracting arrangement with another supplier to deliver any element of the solution which the lead supplier itself may not provide. There may be a need for a direct subscription agreement between the Council and a third party ERP system provider, but this would be for subscription purposes only. The core contractual delivery responsibility for implementation remains with the single lead supplier.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Framework for Service and Testing of Domestic Water Systems
CONTRACT_DESC: The work covered by this contract is intended to meet the continual servicing and monitoring requirements of approved code of practice L8 (the control of legionella bacteria in water systems) and HSG274 to minimise the risk from legionella bacteria and the scalding risk from hot water. Essentially the purpose is to ensure that all domestic hot water and cold water systems are maintained in a safe and hygienically satisfactory condition through a process involving biannual inspection and testing. For the purpose of the tender the systems to be covered by this contract are hot and cold domestic systems, together with any permanently connected equipment (e.g. Rainwater Systems) but excluding air conditioning equipment, swimming pools and hydrotherapy pools. Please note this is a single supplier framework.

Two (2) further one year contract extensions will be available to the successful provider subject to performance review from the sustainable travel team at Lambeth measured against the delivery of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).

CONTRACT_TITLE: Glasgow Alliance to End Homelessness
CONTRACT_DESC: Glasgow City Council (GCC) is seeking to establish an Alliance with provider organisations to end homelessness in Glasgow. The Alliance will plan and deliver a large scale transformational change agenda across the purchased service sector, re-designing and delivering modernised services and support to maximise potential for independent living. The Alliance will work in partnership with individuals with lived experience, statutory services, housing providers and others, towards homelessness prevention and sustainable resettlement, minimise time spent homeless and end rough sleeping for Glasgow Citizens. Provider partners will be expected to pre-form groups to make joint bids and evidence their ability to work collaboratively to deliver the outcomes of the Alliance. The successful pre-formed group will then form an Alliance with GCC. Experience suggests that the optimum size of an effective Alliance would be between six to eight partners, including the commissioning partner.

CONTRACT_BUYER: Department of Health and Social Care
CONTRACT_TITLE: Seroprevalence Broader Population Survey Phase 1
CONTRACT_DESC: A longitudinal seroprevalence survey consisting of regular cross-sectional surveys to get an indication about the percentage of individuals in different age-groups that have already been infected by SARS-CoV2 in the UK. Phase 1  2 500 households from Phase 1A and 2 500 households each from Phases 1B, 1C and 1D. This will be a total of 20 000 households and approximately 50 000 individuals. Phase 1 will start with one cross-sectional survey: subsequent surveys will be repeated in new households approximately every month for 1 year.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Mental Health Supported Living Service — South
CONTRACT_DESC: The London Borough of Camden (‘the Council’) is awarding a contract for the provision of supported living services in the south of Camden. This service forms part of the mental health supported accommodation pathway. The pathway supports adults with severe mental illness who are unable to live independently. The pathway accommodates residents who have lost their tenancies or are unable to live in their own home without support due to the lack of daily living skills. The pathway often bridges the gap between a long stay in hospital and independent living. The mental health supported accommodation pathway fosters Camden’s ambitions to make Camden a place ‘...where everyone can lead happy, healthy and fulfilling lives’, and where ‘no one should experience discrimination or be made to feel ashamed or isolated because of a mental health problem’. This service was previously tendered as two of four lots in August 2019. See OJEU notice 382931-2019.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Area 4 Asset Delivery Maintenance and Response (M&R) Contract
CONTRACT_DESC: Highways England is looking for a suitable contractor to provide and undertake all routine and cyclic maintenance, incident response, defect rectification and severe weather delivery on the all-purpose trunk roads and motorways within the South-East Region Area 4. Additional duties will also include the ongoing maintenance of two tunnels (A20 Roundhill and A27 Southwick), maintenance of roadside technology, the provision of traffic management for the contractor's maintenance and response activities (including traffic management) during incidents and where instructed by Highways England and the maintenance of depots. Under the CDM Regulations 2015 the contractor will be principal contractor for all work they undertake unless instructed otherwise by the service manager.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Radio Network Infrastructure Replacement Reference
CONTRACT_DESC: HM Coastguard were required to monitor VHF and MF Radio transmissions from vessels at sea and provide assistance in case of emergency to prevent loss of life within the UK’s jurisdiction. In order to do this, the current network consists of 155 remote radio sites (RRS), situated around 11 000 miles of UK coastline. This network facilitates all communication transmissions to and from vessels at sea and to the HM Coastguard Watch Officers based at our 10 coastguard operation centres around the UK and the National Maritime Operations centre in Fareham via two data centres.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Replacement of School Admissions, Early Years and Childcare and Children's Centre Software
CONTRACT_DESC: The London Borough of Hounslow (LBH) require a single, harmonised Education system to deliver fast, secure access to a cohesive set of data and documents which will offer a ‘single version of the truth’ about the children and their education needs. Information should be held once across the platform which will be shared across services. This will be managed using sound information governance principles that balance transparency with confidentiality, giving our customers increased confidence to trust us with their data which will support the vision. Digital service delivery must be available for Education and supporting services and will enable online transactional services for customers who will be able to tailor services to reflect their own needs.

CONTRACT_BUYER: The University of Kent Academies Trust
CONTRACT_TITLE: BC-10633 University of Kent Academies Trust Catering
CONTRACT_DESC: The University of Kent Academies Trust is a trust comprised of 2 secondary schools, Brompton Academy and Chatham Grammar School for Girls in Kent. Brompton Academy has approximately 1 400 pupils, and Chatham Grammar has approximately 900. The proposed contract will be for the outsourced provision of catering services to the client. It is the client’s expectation that the successful bidder shall be responsible for the operation of the catering function including employment and management of staff, supply of foodstuffs, consumables and light equipment and preparing and serving appropriate meals. The client will retain responsibility for payment of utilities and the operation and maintenance of core catering equipment and facilities.

CONTRACT_TITLE: Provision of Short-term Care and Support at Home (Reablement, Home Care) and Night Sits
CONTRACT_DESC: Midlands Partnership NHS foundation Trust (MPFT) is looking to procure providers who are able to provide a care and support at home. These services forms part of a suite of integrated prevention and discharge to assess (D2A) ‘Home First’ services across Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent and include provision of reablement service (up to 6 weeks), short term interim home care (pre/post reablement) and Night sits. Services are Lotted by requirement and location (providers are not require required to provide all services).
